commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy module

Changes -
 * Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
 * Add docstring for exception handlers of session
 * Removal of _REPOSITORY global variable.
 * Remove string.lowercase usage
 * Database hook enabling traditional mode at MySQL
 * Replace xrange in for loop with range
 * SQLAlchemy error patterns improved
 * Remove unused import
 * Correct invalid docstrings
 * Remove start index 0 in range()
 * Make _extra_keys a property of ModelBase

Change-Id: If0ecdeb5fefcef36bd14af5a46481cacf2580239

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-23 19:23:43.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': "Support remote VM hosts in boot-seed-vm.

With the upcoming test cluster, we need the ability to boot seed VMs
that are stored on a remote machine. This involves copying the image
onto the machine, chattr +C'ing it and then calling virsh start with
an appropriate URI.

Change-Id: I6194ad94d96aec08105f11acfae61b674a6f15c0
"}]
commit_message:
Support remote VM hosts in boot-seed-vm.

With the upcoming test cluster, we need the ability to boot seed VMs
that are stored on a remote machine. This involves copying the image
onto the machine, chattr +C'ing it and then calling virsh start with
an appropriate URI.

Change-Id: I6194ad94d96aec08105f11acfae61b674a6f15c0

subject: Remove ceilometer from the grenade gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-23 02:49:52.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Remove ceilometer from the grenade gate

Ceilometer doesn't have a grenade upgrade script so if it is installed
by devstack on the old run then having the middleware in the pipeline
means the old version will also be imported on the new run. This can
lead to conflicting requirements.

Change-Id: Ifac7f5df5f6ac013b065e4dc4b582bee7a30d923
Closes-bug: #1262934
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ceilometer from the grenade gate

Ceilometer doesn't have a grenade upgrade script so if it is installed
by devstack on the old run then having the middleware in the pipeline
means the old version will also be imported on the new run. This can
lead to conflicting requirements.

Change-Id: Ifac7f5df5f6ac013b065e4dc4b582bee7a30d923
Closes-bug: #1262934

commit_message:
Nexenta iSCSI driver: use one iSCSI target and group config option

Adds special config option that force using single iSCSI target and
group for Cinder volumes created on NexentaStor appliance volume.

This helps users avoid NexentaStor appliance 255 iSCSI targets
limitiation.

Change-Id: Icb64989bc04deb0eaa5e57c77766ee6ec3e2a67f

subject: Add swift scenario tests
prune grenade service lists to things we can upgrade
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-23 13:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "prune grenade service lists to things we can upgrade

We should only install services in grenade that we know how to
upgrade, otherwise we can run into an issue where we install a
service on the old side, it injects some code using entry points
into other projects, we don't upgrade it, it breaks that service
from upgrading. aka: ceilometer.

We really should have a policy that we only enable services in
grenade that we are going to upgrade. It also calls out nicely
which services those *aren't*.

This patch also does some normalization of the service lists since
we no longer need to support folsom, so cinder and swift should
always be enabled. There is probably a more clever service selector
that could be done here, but this is at least more straight forward
for reviewing.

Change-Id: I4e3975d74082f99b8f13d99a0865886b0e462ae3
"}]
commit_message:
prune grenade service lists to things we can upgrade

We should only install services in grenade that we know how to
upgrade, otherwise we can run into an issue where we install a
service on the old side, it injects some code using entry points
into other projects, we don't upgrade it, it breaks that service
from upgrading. aka: ceilometer.

We really should have a policy that we only enable services in
grenade that we are going to upgrade. It also calls out nicely
which services those *aren't*.

This patch also does some normalization of the service lists since
we no longer need to support folsom, so cinder and swift should
always be enabled. There is probably a more clever service selector
that could be done here, but this is at least more straight forward
for reviewing.

Change-Id: I4e3975d74082f99b8f13d99a0865886b0e462ae3

commit_message:
Allow running just one test with tox

Now, "tox -e py26 -- test.unit.proxy.test_server" runs just that one
test file.

"tox -e py26" still runs all the tests with py26, just like before.

Change-Id: I40db12dd5e7cc8f9388e29b30447f70d3bfc4b28

commit_message:
Remove novnc from vncproxy packages list for Ubuntu

Package resources can no longer have array for name since Puppet 3.4.

Since the package nova-novncproxy already requires novnc,
we can safely remove it from the list of packages to install.

Closes-bug: #1263293
Change-Id: Iba7ff0b7aedd750a54d931e0e8cbe37418ed6aed

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1918, 'name': 'François Charlier', 'email': 'francois.charlier@redhat.com', 'username': 'francois-charlier'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-23 04:18:07.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ironic_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Use database_ prefix for database parameters

A prefix is required to avoid any confusion about
the purpose of those parameters.

puppet-nova uses database_ for those parameters. It makes sense
to use the same in puppet-ironic.

This change breaks backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Id78f5c41a7d0ab0e9fe2430d1f8b9a2cc6a66e05
'}]
commit_message:
Use database_ prefix for database parameters

A prefix is required to avoid any confusion about
the purpose of those parameters.

puppet-nova uses database_ for those parameters. It makes sense
to use the same in puppet-ironic.

This change breaks backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Id78f5c41a7d0ab0e9fe2430d1f8b9a2cc6a66e05

commit_message:
Adding IDH plugin basic implementation

Functionality:

* install and provision Intel Hadoop Manager and Intel Hadoop
* configure Intel Hadoop to use Cinder volumes as HDFS backend
* manual cluster scaling support
* Swift integration
* cluster configs - the same configs as in Vanilla Hadoop
* configs validation - the same as in Vanilla plugin

This is continuation of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56105

This is initial version. It doesn't cover bugs filed here:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bugs?field.searchtext=%7BIDH%5D

Co-Authored-By: Joseph D Natoli <joseph.d.natoli@intel.com>

Implements blueprint idh-savanna-plugin

Change-Id: I23e1fe957e67723ab7011320d0a2b82256695e84

commit_message:
add support for working with pre-datastore instances

Old instances may not have a datastore or datastore version
defined, and the migration process will be highly vendor-specific,
so we need to make sure everything still works as much as possible
with those instances.

Change-Id: Iee5c3ad02c36e10a42937500b0252d913d97b708
Closes-Bug: #1259642

subject: Split seed VM configuring out to a new script.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-23 19:23:43.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm', 'scripts/devtest.sh', 'scripts/setup-seed-vm'], 'message': "Split seed VM configuring out to a new script.

We can't depend on creating the seed VM fresh in the gate environment
- we don't have permission to create VMs as that would let use create
arbitrary libvirt containers unless very carefully controlled.

Having a one-time operation is also a bit easier to reason about:
 - make the VM
 - later make images for it

At any point in time, the VM exists, rather than being deleted and
recreated.

Change-Id: I91e61fdb51afd33a31eb2d3cad01ba8ac019eb59
"}]
commit_message:
Split seed VM configuring out to a new script.

We can't depend on creating the seed VM fresh in the gate environment
- we don't have permission to create VMs as that would let use create
arbitrary libvirt containers unless very carefully controlled.

Having a one-time operation is also a bit easier to reason about:
 - make the VM
 - later make images for it

At any point in time, the VM exists, rather than being deleted and
recreated.

Change-Id: I91e61fdb51afd33a31eb2d3cad01ba8ac019eb59

subject: Change default ephemeral FS to ext4.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-19 20:45:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': 'Change default ephemeral FS to ext4.

The ext3 filesystem does orders of magnitude more I/O than ext4 in
mkfs - a brief benchmark showed 14m to make a 1TB ext3 filesystem
vs 7 seconds to make a 1TB ext4 filesystem, with the ext3 filesystem
doing upwards of 6GB I/O.

Since ext4 has been a default in all major Linux distributions for
a long time now - RHEL5 has it as default, for instance - there is
no reason to default to ext3: users that need ext3 can configure
that themselves.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I833356af81df743a63d4442d389be82bc25f3914
'}]
commit_message:
Change default ephemeral FS to ext4.

The ext3 filesystem does orders of magnitude more I/O than ext4 in
mkfs - a brief benchmark showed 14m to make a 1TB ext3 filesystem
vs 7 seconds to make a 1TB ext4 filesystem, with the ext3 filesystem
doing upwards of 6GB I/O.

Since ext4 has been a default in all major Linux distributions for
a long time now - RHEL5 has it as default, for instance - there is
no reason to default to ext3: users that need ext3 can configure
that themselves.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I833356af81df743a63d4442d389be82bc25f3914

commit_message:
Set volume_dd_blocksize configurable on per-driver basis

Allow volume_dd_blocksize config option to be configurable on a
per-driver basis.
This allows drivers used in multi-backend configurations
to define their own values. We port this to the LVM and block_device
drivers here but it can easily be ported to others as and when
needed.

DocImpact

partially implement bp: per-driver-config-for-utils-functions

Change-Id: Ice9e815f18e5ebf3727aab7d3a221acacb710cd4

commit_message:
Timeout devstack/tempest internally

Abort the run of the gate script within the wrap script
after a specified time (60 minutes by default).  The wrap
script will be able to proceed to copy log files as usual
in case of a timeout.

Remove xtrace option that slipped in during earlier
devstack-gate testing.

Change-Id: I000fae1365534b204ab27f2014ba64eabafc7584

commit_message:
Initialize iptables rules on initialization of MetadataManager

To avoid multiple initialization of iptables rules if there are a few
workers for metadata service, perform iptables configuration in
__init__() of MetadataManager.

Change-Id: I674c04f973318f06cbb98693f0a884c824af8748
Closes-Bug: #1097999

commit_message:
Set DIB_COMMON_ELEMENTS in devtest_overcloud.sh

For the cd-overcloud devtest_overcloud.sh is being run standalone
outside of devtest.sh. So this needs to be set seperately. This should
be followed with a patch to t-i-e/elements/tripleo-cd/tripleo-cd.sh to
set an appropriate value.

subject: Unconditionaly do pvcreate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-23 16:20:26.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/snippets/cinder_create_lvm_group.erb', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/scripts/pmanager.py'], 'message': "Unconditionaly do pvcreate

During the disk partitioning pmanager runs pvcreate
which asks for confirmation on wiping out the volume
group if it is found there. There was another fix
which does dd to clean up all information about
all disk partionins, so pvcreate should not ask
anything. This patch adds '-y' option to pvcreate,
and it writes changes without asking questions,
so we can be double sure that installation won't
stuck under some other condition on this command.

Change-Id: I7368ce58fa54155664d59adedbfc0463f7d3a3ea
"}]
commit_message:
Unconditionaly do pvcreate

During the disk partitioning pmanager runs pvcreate
which asks for confirmation on wiping out the volume
group if it is found there. There was another fix
which does dd to clean up all information about
all disk partionins, so pvcreate should not ask
anything. This patch adds '-y' option to pvcreate,
and it writes changes without asking questions,
so we can be double sure that installation won't
stuck under some other condition on this command.

Change-Id: I7368ce58fa54155664d59adedbfc0463f7d3a3ea

subject: Setting the xen vm device id on vm record
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-18 06:27:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py', 'nova/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Setting the xen vm device id on vm record

Currently, while setting the device_id, the hypervisor
version is being incorrectly handled since the method
get_major_minor_version expects either an int, float,
or string format. However, the xen hypervisor
version is stored in the session product_version as a tuple.
This fix correctly uses the version to set the appropriate
device_id on the vm record. Also, removing the method
get_major_minor_version as it is not needed anymore.

Closes-bug: #1260178

Change-Id: I6b1353cdb7cc856b34f02e3d3679c142ba032533
'}]
commit_message:
Setting the xen vm device id on vm record

Currently, while setting the device_id, the hypervisor
version is being incorrectly handled since the method
get_major_minor_version expects either an int, float,
or string format. However, the xen hypervisor
version is stored in the session product_version as a tuple.
This fix correctly uses the version to set the appropriate
device_id on the vm record. Also, removing the method
get_major_minor_version as it is not needed anymore.

Closes-bug: #1260178

Change-Id: I6b1353cdb7cc856b34f02e3d3679c142ba032533

subject: pass the empty body into the controller
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-12-21 13:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_extensions.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_consoles.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_consoles.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/consoles.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/consoles.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/test_wsgi.py', 'nova/api/openstack/extensions.py'], 'message': 'pass the empty body into the controller

This allows POST and PUT reqeusts without content-body. The
default body: None will be passed into the controller, and
will be validated in the controller, so it fixes the bug 1253089.

When the request method is GET or DELETE, the content-type
and body in the request will be ignored
.
When POST or PUT a request with body but without content-type,
it will return "unsupported the content-type provided" with
response code 400.

side-effect: The method which handle the request method: POST
or PUT must have the parameter: body. Otherwise, it will raise:
"got an unexpected keyword argument 'body'"

And some tests are updated due to this change.
The parameter: body are also added for some actions which are
mapped to the method: POST or PUT.

Closes-bug: 1253089

Change-Id: Icda59feed439625bbbe079444feeda57576ef131
'}]
commit_message:
pass the empty body into the controller

This allows POST and PUT reqeusts without content-body. The
default body: None will be passed into the controller, and
will be validated in the controller, so it fixes the bug 1253089.

When the request method is GET or DELETE, the content-type
and body in the request will be ignored
.
When POST or PUT a request with body but without content-type,
it will return "unsupported the content-type provided" with
response code 400.

side-effect: The method which handle the request method: POST
or PUT must have the parameter: body. Otherwise, it will raise:
"got an unexpected keyword argument 'body'"

And some tests are updated due to this change.
The parameter: body are also added for some actions which are
mapped to the method: POST or PUT.

Closes-bug: 1253089

Change-Id: Icda59feed439625bbbe079444feeda57576ef131

commit_message:
Implement cancelling of stack update

This patch implements triggering of stack rollback upon receiving
`cancel` as `update_type` parameter of the stack update request.

Also implements `CancelUpdateStack` action of CFN API
using the above new functionality.

Change-Id: I87af9cfa2b010293e2b1dae8f943c58497839a76
Implements: blueprint cancel-update-stack

commit_message:
VMware: image aging support

Images that are unused will be marked for aging. These images
will be deleted after they have not been used for
'remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds'.

The third and final phase of blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

Change-Id: Ie9f33a173e2f29e467348dfecb08f281c264c57e

When a job fails you would like to look in the logs for ERRORs but you can't
since there are so many bogus ERRORs masked by the whitelist. Now you will
see the non-whitelisted errors in the logs on failure.

Change-Id: I9ae041c218782b9b4431c8d89febdedd377bfbc9

commit_message:
Always dump errors to console

When a job fails you would like to look in the logs for ERRORs but you can't
since there are so many bogus ERRORs masked by the whitelist. Now you will
see the non-whitelisted errors in the logs on failure.

Change-Id: I9ae041c218782b9b4431c8d89febdedd377bfbc9

commit_message:
Don't run volumes/disks checking in case
if node was provisioned

* add checking if node was provisioned
* make checking methods as protected
  instead of private, because they
  shouldn't be private from design point
  of view, it simplify unit testing

Closes-bug: #1262973
Change-Id: I036c16138c48054579eb1d8388d048ac7331c041

commit_message:
Adds keypairs support for the Nova V3 API

Adds support and tests for the keypairs extension for
the Nova V3 API. The V3 version of the keypair extension
has been made part of the core V3 API and as a result no longer
has the "os-" prefix in the url.

Differences between the V2 and V3 API are described here:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: Id4a77e1e4565f63ecdf7753d3c224975519fc07c

subject: remove last errant file parse warning
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-23 01:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/generate_sample_tempest.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': "remove last errant file parse warning

provide a way to be able to instantiate the config object without
parsing a config file. This is expected to only be used for the
config file generator comparitor.

This means we finally don't generate warning messages on config
file parsing during our pep8 runs, and we do the right thing and
explode during tests if the config file doesn't exist in a real
way.

Change-Id: Ic4ae22814e2fdafc89a1997471283ccf8f3663bc
"}]
commit_message:
remove last errant file parse warning

provide a way to be able to instantiate the config object without
parsing a config file. This is expected to only be used for the
config file generator comparitor.

This means we finally don't generate warning messages on config
file parsing during our pep8 runs, and we do the right thing and
explode during tests if the config file doesn't exist in a real
way.

Change-Id: Ic4ae22814e2fdafc89a1997471283ccf8f3663bc

commit_message:
Factor out common image elements

Adds a DIB_COMMON_ELEMENTS env var that contains a list of elements
to be used in all image builds.  At this time that includes
pypi-openstack, pip-cache, and stackuser.

Change-Id: I74c39bc356f6064a5db4ddfdd86285672c4a656a

subject: Add class ModelsObjectComparatorMixin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-23 13:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/test.py', 'tests/unit/test_base.py'], 'message': "Add class ModelsObjectComparatorMixin

Move class ModelsObjectComparatorMixin from nova.tests.db.test_db_api
to oslo-incubator, so we could reuse it in other projects.

This class have following methods:
- assertEqualObjects: check equal of the two dict, possible
exception of some keys.
- assertEqualListsOfObjects: check equal of the two lists. List's
object is dict.
- assertEqualListsOfPrimitivesAsSets: check equal of the two dict,
whose values are set.

Change-Id: Idbe607ea3fd42f35eafc8e38b7e75153998828a7
"}]
commit_message:
Add class ModelsObjectComparatorMixin

Move class ModelsObjectComparatorMixin from nova.tests.db.test_db_api
to oslo-incubator, so we could reuse it in other projects.

This class have following methods:
- assertEqualObjects: check equal of the two dict, possible
exception of some keys.
- assertEqualListsOfObjects: check equal of the two lists. List's
object is dict.
- assertEqualListsOfPrimitivesAsSets: check equal of the two dict,
whose values are set.

Change-Id: Idbe607ea3fd42f35eafc8e38b7e75153998828a7

subject: SignalResponder store access/secret in resource data
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7135, 'name': 'Liang Chen', 'email': 'liangchen.linux@gmail.com', 'username': 'Liang'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-18 21:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_signal.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling.py', 'heat/engine/signal_responder.py'], 'message': 'SignalResponder store access/secret in resource data

We need to stop relying on the logic in heat_keystoneclient which
assumes there is only one keypair per user, as this assumption
may not remain true in future.

So instead, store the access/secret key in the DB as resource data,
which is probably better from a performance perspective anyway, and
will also allow SignalResponder subclasses to potentially override
the default credentials implementation more easily.

Change-Id: I7952181f30c94848acf358ab34cf17b6281d43ac
Partial-Bug: #1089261
blueprint: instance-users
'}]
commit_message:
SignalResponder store access/secret in resource data

We need to stop relying on the logic in heat_keystoneclient which
assumes there is only one keypair per user, as this assumption
may not remain true in future.

So instead, store the access/secret key in the DB as resource data,
which is probably better from a performance perspective anyway, and
will also allow SignalResponder subclasses to potentially override
the default credentials implementation more easily.

Change-Id: I7952181f30c94848acf358ab34cf17b6281d43ac
Partial-Bug: #1089261
blueprint: instance-users

commit_message:
chore: Bump version to icehouse-2 dev

This patch makes our version more specific in preparation for doing
interim project releases for each OpenStack milestone. The OS wiki
does not specify what to do about "development" versions, so I
decided to follow the standard Python convention.

Change-Id: Icae5b7abbb33969a60b3a517b9a016016180d0f5

subject: Add support for multiple encryption methods
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-16 09:05:42.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/crypt.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/032_decrypt_method.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py'], 'message': 'Add support for multiple encryption methods

We use only one encrypt() method but it returns the method to decrypt
the data. This way we can change the encryption mechanism but
always have a way to know how to decrypt whatever is stored.

Change-Id: I2315a33105a8766f69d02f0617af39a9dae19ddf
Partial-bug: #1251647
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for multiple encryption methods

We use only one encrypt() method but it returns the method to decrypt
the data. This way we can change the encryption mechanism but
always have a way to know how to decrypt whatever is stored.

Change-Id: I2315a33105a8766f69d02f0617af39a9dae19ddf
Partial-bug: #1251647

commit_message:
Object-ify build_and_run_instance

The code for build_and_run_instance was put in place before the switch
to using Instance objects.  This updates the new boot process code to
use objects rather than dictionaries for instances.

bp remove-cast-to-schedule-run-instance

Change-Id: I47866536e924510d0d89d24336e0b690733c19e1

commit_message:
Fix check_networks task result

1. "id" renamed to "ids".
2. "ids" and "errors" are always lists.
3. "range_errors" removed.
4. "errors" values are subsets of NetworkGroup fields names.

Closes-Bug: #1263097

Change-Id: I30bb13c4613cf0b5a3f604ca350b2a594cbdf924

commit_message:
Add negative tests to lbaas api tests

lbaas api tests do not contain tests that check that if used fake
pool will not have be:
- created member/vip;
- accosiated health_monitor.
Also it is not checked that pool can not be deleted if there is a vip
created from it.

Closes-bug: #1262113

Change-Id: Iec0e47dddeb4a31baa9e6fe80369eced9c487ede

commit_message:
Disable heat for RHOS, backport swift ring builder for RHOS 3.0

Heat manifests still lack qpid support, so it needs
to be disabled during deployment.
Swift ring builder output changed for Havana, but a backport
is needed for RHOS 3.0.
Changes marked as FIXME

commit_message:
Delegate port creation to the plugin driver

Allow plugin driver to create/delete l2 port on vip creation/deletion.
Plugin driver may have better knowledge about how to wire vip into the
tenant network. Also it is possible to share l2 ports for multiple vips.

Haproxy and Radware plugin drivers are updated with common method
that creates l2 port. Nicira service plugin was also fixed with corresponding
code.

Also, due to async and multithreading nature of radware driver, corresponding
tests were changed to manual vip deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1207986

Change-Id: I91d688912881ea12332cc592004efb8e1d4a09a8

This patch fixes migration 128e042a2b68_ext_gw_mode.py,
63afba73813_ovs_tunnelendpoints_id_unique.py and
f9263d6df56_remove_dhcp_lease.py with SQLite 3. For these

commit_message:
Fix alembic migration

This patch fixes migration 128e042a2b68_ext_gw_mode.py,
63afba73813_ovs_tunnelendpoints_id_unique.py and
f9263d6df56_remove_dhcp_lease.py with SQLite 3. For these
last 2, it replaces create_unique_constraint() and
drop_column() by the corresponding SQL statements using
a temporary table (which is the only way with SQLite 3).

Closes-Bug: #1241577

Change-Id: I6c81c30302f98f7d3ca733f280ec1ae7dd802f55

subject: Add a cleanup option to source-repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-11-27 16:39:29.000000000', 'files': ['elements/source-repositories/cleanup.d/50-source-repositories', 'elements/source-repositories/README.md', 'elements/source-repositories/extra-data.d/98-source-repositories'], 'message': 'Add a cleanup option to source-repositories

This allows element writers to express that the destination directory
should be removed during the cleanup phase before finalising the image.

The use case for this is source trees that are used to install code
elsewhere, for example pulling down OpenStack just to pip install from the
git tree into a virtualenv. The tree does not need to stay in the image.

Removing these trees will make the images smaller which should improve
build/upload/transfer times.

Change-Id: I9a599c8b713a865579873f2cf5b3667b5d4b34b1
'}]
commit_message:
Add a cleanup option to source-repositories

This allows element writers to express that the destination directory
should be removed during the cleanup phase before finalising the image.

The use case for this is source trees that are used to install code
elsewhere, for example pulling down OpenStack just to pip install from the
git tree into a virtualenv. The tree does not need to stay in the image.

Removing these trees will make the images smaller which should improve
build/upload/transfer times.

Change-Id: I9a599c8b713a865579873f2cf5b3667b5d4b34b1

subject: Specify targets in the first line of template file
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-11 22:56:41.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': 'Specify targets in the first line of template file

The format of the first line to specify targets:

... TARGETS=path1,path2,...

And the target path can be variables, which is determined in json when
applying configuration.

If TARGETS are not specified, original output file will be used.

Change-Id: I57cfddf5f26a7efd651ea81a4d34cb7ea7707730
Closes-Bug: #1258351
'}]
commit_message:
Specify targets in the first line of template file

The format of the first line to specify targets:

... TARGETS=path1,path2,...

And the target path can be variables, which is determined in json when
applying configuration.

If TARGETS are not specified, original output file will be used.

Change-Id: I57cfddf5f26a7efd651ea81a4d34cb7ea7707730
Closes-Bug: #1258351

commit_message:
Use DictOpt for mapping options

oslo.config supports dictionary options from version 1.2.0a1.
Currently the mapping options in neutron are using ListOpts which
does not well match their usage. Using DictOpt would be more intuitive.

Fixes bug #1237162

Change-Id: I7d9009db31cf14e45e0d480c5ba5dd716f005290

commit_message:
Install Guide: Clarify database node setup

Some people were not aware that they needed to install MySQL packages
on nodes. This patch rearranges the code so that we have separate
sections for controller and node and thus readers should easily
spot what needs to be done.

Change-Id: I104b949466b426e102d55bcb3c4a9cb72a0a6af9
Closes-Bug: #1250600
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 54b57d1746ce5451e7412eb3f60068d0273f2ad1)

commit_message:
Added step to make sure 'root_helper' key references 'neutron'

In the current Neutron Havana packages for RHEL-style distributions,
the default 'root_helper' key in neutron.conf references 'quantum'
instead of 'neutron'. This issue should get fixed upstream, but in
the meantime I added a step to make sure this key references
'neutron'.

Change-Id: I25f9faaba1067040829633aff990d238f5bf4ced
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1258309

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 177, 'name': 'Alex Meade', 'email': 'mr.alex.meade@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex-meade'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 7884, 'name': 'Noboru Arai', 'email': 'arai@mxa.nes.nec.co.jp', 'username': 'NoboruArai'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-09 15:31:49.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Idbf8e08383232ae0af5b245c1abe91a7f852bfcf
"}]
commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Idbf8e08383232ae0af5b245c1abe91a7f852bfcf

commit_message:
disable SIGHUP restart behavior in foreground

SIGHUP should only be a restart action for a daemonized processs,
when used on a console process SIGHUP should == SIGTERM. Add
detection for whether this service is actually daemonized.

Change-Id: I2a73d3872a302fcfac1a6ee844a44faa9569b3dd
Fixes-Bug: #1263122

commit_message:
Indicate pseudo-folders in containers panel

The column that shows size of Objects is empty for pseudo folders.
We now indicate that this is a pseudo-folder.
Column does not have a column header so should not be confusing.
Also, show the size if the object is of size 0, (thanks Tihomir)

Closes-Bug: #1260859
Change-Id: I1ac233f5b964befa3d4f36c9a3d309383d691d28

commit_message:
Fix QoS information in initialize_connection() result

Currently the entire QoS information (if any) is included in the result of
initialize_connection() even if the consumer of the QoS is 'back-end'. Also
the format for QoS specs also is changed so that front-end (Nova) can
parse correctly. Add unit test to cover initialize_connection().

Closes-bug: 1259957

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibc5e92cc1ddf6404e5b234ef524698feae282eec

commit_message:
Document security group when using ML2 plugin

Since the ML2 plugin can concurrently support different L2 agents (or
other mechanisms) with different configurations, Neutron developpers
recommend setting firewall_driver flag in ml2 configuration.

Change-Id: I7f97128a955ded99400e25a5ef9a990260df3bf7
Closes-bug: #1262678
backport: havana
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4c5d9ba37bb2cebedb05aabab3452a5e0005f985)

commit_message:
Implement matchmaker for ZeroMQ

ZeroMQ in devstack is configured to use redis, which is not the reccomended
configuration, and is not working. This patch changes the matchmaker to ring,
and creates all topics with a default of the local machine's hostname.

This is dependent upon I8514f178 in cinder

Change-Id: I3f62f7a9d6c7cd576abadefe43d61e952834d1b3
Partial-Bug: #1185690

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

subject: Make live migration RPC tasks timeout configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-13 18:33:22.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Make live migration RPC tasks timeout configurable

Add an option live_migration_rpc_timeout for live migration pre/post methods.
Some of these cost a long time to return, so rpc_response_time isn't suit for
those RPC methods. For instance, pre_live_migration on destination node take
a long time if the base image of the instance to be moved is not yet cached
and large. The default RPC timeout of 60s is insufficient for this.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2accfdda59f8aa74a95910d2be081ad94d5e4490
Closes-Bug: 1243601
"}]
commit_message:
Make live migration RPC tasks timeout configurable

Add an option live_migration_rpc_timeout for live migration pre/post methods.
Some of these cost a long time to return, so rpc_response_time isn't suit for
those RPC methods. For instance, pre_live_migration on destination node take
a long time if the base image of the instance to be moved is not yet cached
and large. The default RPC timeout of 60s is insufficient for this.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2accfdda59f8aa74a95910d2be081ad94d5e4490
Closes-Bug: 1243601

subject: RFC: Call create_test_server in setUp() method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-21 16:25:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_server_metadata.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_servers_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_server_addresses.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_instance_actions.py'], 'message': 'RFC: Call create_test_server in setUp() method

If a server creation fails with create_test_server() in setUpClass,
the server would not be removed because tearDownclass is not called.
As the result, many BuildError servers are created and "Quota exceeded"
happens if server creations continue to fail.

This patch moves create_test_server call to each setUp() method for
deleting BuildError servers in tearDownClass.

NOTE:
 This patch is imcomplete, we need to fix the other many test files.
 There is alternative patch(I55bb386bbea550de11cc7a81c5d056680057523b).
 I'd like to know which way is best for fixing this problem.

Change-Id: I6f86bb63f3fafd5561f88785567aa7ec45d36d22
Related-Bug: #1257641
'}]
commit_message:
RFC: Call create_test_server in setUp() method

If a server creation fails with create_test_server() in setUpClass,
the server would not be removed because tearDownclass is not called.
As the result, many BuildError servers are created and "Quota exceeded"
happens if server creations continue to fail.

This patch moves create_test_server call to each setUp() method for
deleting BuildError servers in tearDownClass.

NOTE:
 This patch is imcomplete, we need to fix the other many test files.
 There is alternative patch(I55bb386bbea550de11cc7a81c5d056680057523b).
 I'd like to know which way is best for fixing this problem.

Change-Id: I6f86bb63f3fafd5561f88785567aa7ec45d36d22
Related-Bug: #1257641

commit_message:
Replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems()

dict.iteritems() was replaced with dict.items() in Python 3. Use the
six.iteritems() function to get code compatible with Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I0c8ecc3ae540ffaf4c6b159e09ca16ccf365973d

commit_message:
Encode response from FakeHTTPClient

While working on [1], found that python 3.3 gate is failing [2].

In python 3.3 requests library expects response to be encoded. So encode
the same if it is not already.

Also add test for FakeHTTPClient.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58067
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/67/58067/4/check/gate-python-solumclient-python33/15dc135/console.html.gz

Part of blueprint make-python3-compatible

Change-Id: I9af04e52bfa38f5c943dbc4929abb5e3161ef9b4

subject: Fix cinder test cases when cinder extensions are in use
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-17 21:58:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_list.py'], 'message': "Fix cinder test cases when cinder extensions are in use

When cinder extension like extended_snapshot_attributes or volume_mig_status_attribute
are used this laters add extra attributes to response of queries 'show' and 'detail' but
not 'list', which mean the return response from 'show' and 'list' will not be identical,
so we should only compare result from 'list' and 'show' of specific attribute e.g.
id, display_name ... .

Closes-Bug: #1245377
Change-Id: I52fd9cf7cb2e67c04f575bfeb00e66660e00947d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder test cases when cinder extensions are in use

When cinder extension like extended_snapshot_attributes or volume_mig_status_attribute
are used this laters add extra attributes to response of queries 'show' and 'detail' but
not 'list', which mean the return response from 'show' and 'list' will not be identical,
so we should only compare result from 'list' and 'show' of specific attribute e.g.
id, display_name ... .

Closes-Bug: #1245377
Change-Id: I52fd9cf7cb2e67c04f575bfeb00e66660e00947d

subject: Reduce the severity of dhcp related log traces
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-18 20:12:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_db_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/db/dhcp_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': "Reduce the severity of dhcp related log traces

Due to timing issues, when the agent synchronizes
with the server wrt the representation of server's
and agent's networks, networks may have already
been deleted from the db. In such circumstances,
it is more appropriate to emit warnings rather than
full-blown exceptions as the agent handles these
circumstances just fine.

Close-bug: 1251874

(cherry picked from commit f1b9ac5a542a3125d757094fccda80c80c6dd420)

Conflicts:

        neutron/agent/dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I4b118b6087c7f42226f0d4265d2176c028d99f22
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce the severity of dhcp related log traces

Due to timing issues, when the agent synchronizes
with the server wrt the representation of server's
and agent's networks, networks may have already
been deleted from the db. In such circumstances,
it is more appropriate to emit warnings rather than
full-blown exceptions as the agent handles these
circumstances just fine.

Close-bug: 1251874

(cherry picked from commit f1b9ac5a542a3125d757094fccda80c80c6dd420)

Conflicts:

        neutron/agent/dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I4b118b6087c7f42226f0d4265d2176c028d99f22

subject: Work around broken cloud-init ephemeral disk code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-21 16:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['elements/use-ephemeral/os-refresh-config/pre-configure.d/00-fix-ephemeral-mount'], 'message': "Work around broken cloud-init ephemeral disk code

Cloud-init cannot handle ephemeral disks like '/dev/sda1'. This prevents
the nova baremetal default from working properly. So if the ephemeral
disk isn't already mounted, we mount it just before we need it.

Change-Id: Ide0e5ed3eff91755aac7d8f1e9c43f723f7bf3d5
Closes-Bug: #1263294
"}]
commit_message:
Work around broken cloud-init ephemeral disk code

Cloud-init cannot handle ephemeral disks like '/dev/sda1'. This prevents
the nova baremetal default from working properly. So if the ephemeral
disk isn't already mounted, we mount it just before we need it.

Change-Id: Ide0e5ed3eff91755aac7d8f1e9c43f723f7bf3d5
Closes-Bug: #1263294

NotImplementedError back up to the API.  Catch this and return a 501.

subject: Revert recent change to ComputeNode
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-21 00:59:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_compute_node.py'], 'message': "Revert recent change to ComputeNode

This reverts the object-related parts of 4c21f4a. The problems with
it are:

- It didn't bump the object version
- It introduced a JSON blob string attribute to the object,
  which is unversioned structured data, which can't be
  checked or guaranteed during upgrades.

The first one, of course, breaks live upgrade because an older
node receives fields it doesn't know about, but should based on
the version.

Offending change I75e339c2a2827875078c937e57c37e85d3ad1852

Change-Id: Ie280dc6fe27e48aea9939131c9e695c60b132414
"}]
commit_message:
Revert recent change to ComputeNode

This reverts the object-related parts of 4c21f4a. The problems with
it are:

- It didn't bump the object version
- It introduced a JSON blob string attribute to the object,
  which is unversioned structured data, which can't be
  checked or guaranteed during upgrades.

The first one, of course, breaks live upgrade because an older
node receives fields it doesn't know about, but should based on
the version.

Offending change I75e339c2a2827875078c937e57c37e85d3ad1852

Change-Id: Ie280dc6fe27e48aea9939131c9e695c60b132414

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-12-13 15:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/extensions/extra_dhcp_opt.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_attributes.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_extradhcpopts.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py'], 'message': 'extra_dhcp_opt add checks for empty strings

When passing extra-dhcp-opt into the port-create where an empty string
is provided as opt_value='   ', the create and update routine will load the
empty string into the DB. The result when written to the opts file is:
"tag:ece4c8aa-15c9-4f6b-8c42-7d4e285734bf,option:server-ip-address", which
when read by dnsmasq has been tested to cause dnsmasq to segment fault.

Change-Id: I31de4a3d27092bb219d20221c5ef5a6b22e050dc
Closes-Bug: #1257467
'}]
commit_message:
extra_dhcp_opt add checks for empty strings

When passing extra-dhcp-opt into the port-create where an empty string
is provided as opt_value='   ', the create and update routine will load the
empty string into the DB. The result when written to the opts file is:
"tag:ece4c8aa-15c9-4f6b-8c42-7d4e285734bf,option:server-ip-address", which
when read by dnsmasq has been tested to cause dnsmasq to segment fault.

Change-Id: I31de4a3d27092bb219d20221c5ef5a6b22e050dc
Closes-Bug: #1257467

commit_message:
XenAPI: Update DomU to Ubuntu Saucy

Driven by a race condition in LVM being hit in the tempest
tests.  This is a locking race between a file lock and a
semaphore which is fixed in 2.02.96-5.

Change-Id: I8a8c215c90a0602288292ffd06b7694d2db6219e

subject: Fix the option of a2ensite command
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-20 11:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_thirdparty/trema'], 'message': 'Fix the option of a2ensite command

devstack fails with trema when  execute
"sudo a2ensite sliceable_switch" command, without ".conf" filename extension
with Apache2.4, Apache2.22. With Apache 2.2, it successes.
Because in the versions which newer than version 2.2,
file checking of a2ensite command is more severe.
So, a2ensite command forbid "sliceable_switch" without "/conf".

Added ".conf" filename extension.

Change-Id: I29a03cb59ee493345b7df0f1a9189eb3516c86e2
Closes-Bug: #1263017
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the option of a2ensite command

devstack fails with trema when  execute
"sudo a2ensite sliceable_switch" command, without ".conf" filename extension
with Apache2.4, Apache2.22. With Apache 2.2, it successes.
Because in the versions which newer than version 2.2,
file checking of a2ensite command is more severe.
So, a2ensite command forbid "sliceable_switch" without "/conf".

Added ".conf" filename extension.

Change-Id: I29a03cb59ee493345b7df0f1a9189eb3516c86e2
Closes-Bug: #1263017

subject: Explicily enable the stores used by devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-20 17:57:36.000000000', 'files': ['lib/glance'], 'message': "Explicily enable the stores used by devstack

Devstack currently relies on the default value of the `known_stores`
configuration option. This patch enables explicitly the default stores
used by devstack.

The real fix for the issue below will land in Glance. However, since the
default stores will be FS and HTTP we need devstack to enable Swift's as
well, which is required in the gates, hence this patch.

Partially-fixes: #1255556
Change-Id: Id9aab356b36b2150312324a0349d120bbbbd4e63
"}]
commit_message:
Explicily enable the stores used by devstack

Devstack currently relies on the default value of the `known_stores`
configuration option. This patch enables explicitly the default stores
used by devstack.

The real fix for the issue below will land in Glance. However, since the
default stores will be FS and HTTP we need devstack to enable Swift's as
well, which is required in the gates, hence this patch.

Partially-fixes: #1255556
Change-Id: Id9aab356b36b2150312324a0349d120bbbbd4e63

subject: config: get_meta_section() misunderstands the beginning of metasection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 03:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/config'], 'message': 'config: get_meta_section() misunderstands the beginning of metasection

For example, the line, "if [[ -n $no_proxy ]]; then" is misparsed
as the beginning of metasection because get_meta_section() misses
escaping of "|" unlike get_meta_section_files().
This patch adds necessary escape as "|" -> "\|".

Change-Id: Ic14b2ac167037c4f5db89492f0e8a4c5b13c7b6d
Closes-Bug: #1262960
'}]
commit_message:
config: get_meta_section() misunderstands the beginning of metasection

For example, the line, "if [[ -n $no_proxy ]]; then" is misparsed
as the beginning of metasection because get_meta_section() misses
escaping of "|" unlike get_meta_section_files().
This patch adds necessary escape as "|" -> "\|".

Change-Id: Ic14b2ac167037c4f5db89492f0e8a4c5b13c7b6d
Closes-Bug: #1262960

subject: Allow specifying CM alarm evaluation interval
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 09:02:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceilometer'], 'message': 'Allow specifying CM alarm evaluation interval

The patch allows users to configure Ceilometer alarm evaluation interval.
We can add CEILOMETER_ALARM_EVALUATION_INTERVAL=10 in localrc to evaluate
alarms every 10 seconds instead of the default 60 seconds.

Change-Id: Ie2f2dc93b5915845b6dcbf8ac9d15ca0fe800c5a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow specifying CM alarm evaluation interval

The patch allows users to configure Ceilometer alarm evaluation interval.
We can add CEILOMETER_ALARM_EVALUATION_INTERVAL=10 in localrc to evaluate
alarms every 10 seconds instead of the default 60 seconds.

Change-Id: Ie2f2dc93b5915845b6dcbf8ac9d15ca0fe800c5a

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-20 12:18:42.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/tests/quotas.py', 'openstack_dashboard/usage/quotas.py'], 'message': "Add missing __contains__() and get() methods to QuotaUsage

The QuotaUsage class was missing __contains__() and get() methods which was
causing unexpected behaviour, e.g:

    >>> usages = quotas.tenant_quota_usages(request)
    >>> 'ram' in usages
    False
    >>> usages.get('ram')
    None

Change-Id: Ib0b1ad69c4bf4effd7c10827d23bcc713bdc5ed6
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing __contains__() and get() methods to QuotaUsage

The QuotaUsage class was missing __contains__() and get() methods which was
causing unexpected behaviour, e.g:

    >>> usages = quotas.tenant_quota_usages(request)
    >>> 'ram' in usages
    False
    >>> usages.get('ram')
    None

Change-Id: Ib0b1ad69c4bf4effd7c10827d23bcc713bdc5ed6

commit_message:
Add check for BlockDeviceMappingV2 nova extension

Booting instance from image (creates a volume) option is using
the new BDM format when submitting the create server request to
Nova. Adding a check for Nova extensions if it is supported
before displaying the option.

Closes-bug: #1223875

In the original fix API call is not wrapped with try/except
and it was fixed in bug 1262223 in master. The fix is also
cherry-picked from commit a10436e6a376fb2c3478796e7ad728eb0e1f0ba3.

Related-bug: #1262223

Change-Id: Ie0b2b5d574babc910e2dac7ce9e3ab6603382ffb
(cherry picked from commit a10436e6a376fb2c3478796e7ad728eb0e1f0ba3)

commit_message:
port related volumes tests into nova v3 part2

there is no cinder proxy in nova v3 api. So we just use cinder
directly. And some tests are duplication with the tests in cinder
testing, just remove them, add merge the remain tests under the
server tests directory.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

commit_message:
Redundant validation for rebuild

Remove the redundant validation for rebuild. In fact that this extension
is registered as WSGI action implies that the body must contain a key with
the same name as action

Change-Id: I101ca74a015d0615736fba2080c3bb3e4cbdc96d
Closes-bug: #1254982

Fixes bug #1259733

commit_message:
Replace uuidutils.generate_uuid() with str(uuid.uuid4())

Oslo is deprecating/removing uuidutils during the icehouse cycle.
Consequently we need to remove all references to uuidutils, and
replace them with the corresponding function from trove.utils.

Closes-bug: 1253497

Change-Id: I7f877238fdad6a6160c927bee0bd8e4f8d638117

commit_message:
Modular L2 TypeDriver refact (ovs-agent)

Deprecate the segmentation_id/physical_network inside segment, only keep
network_type as required. And type driver can extend segment with
arbitrary data, also take charge of storing the data. The service pass
the entire segment to the agent instead of 3 separate arguments.

This is ovs agent patch

Change-Id: I9b76a7f79607a64570a05d44a1bfea591d78148c
Implements: blueprint ml2-typedriver-extra-port-info

commit_message:
Modular L2 TypeDriver refact (service)

Deprecate the segmentation_id/physical_network inside segment, only keep
network_type as required. And type driver can extend segment with
arbitrary data, also take charge of storing the data. The service pass
the entire segment to the agent instead of 3 separate arguments.

Now agent changes are in separate patches

Change-Id: Idf1b717059d4da7c2d6ca83f2217064bc3234447
Implements: blueprint ml2-typedriver-extra-port-info

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 17:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
add router binding into firewall

In this patch, I removed the limit that one
tenant just has only one firewall.

I allow user to bind a router when creating or
update a firewall. On agent side, the agent will
just apply the hosted routers' related firewalls.

Implements: blueprint router-firewall-binding
Change-Id: I3a6446c2e8dcfe1998f2520185db6bf482100309

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-09 02:00:59.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ml2'], 'message': "ML2 can't seem to load type drivers

fixes bug: 1221781

When ML2 plugin is initialized using Devstack, jsonrpclib is not
installed. This prevents some type drivers from starting up.

A fix is introduced such that when ML2 plugin is configured using
devstack, jsonroplib is installed. This package needs to be installed
only on the server node. Hence the package is installed in routine
neutron_plugin_configure_service().
Initially, it is used by Arista mechanism driver.
In future, it may be used by other drivers as well.

Change-Id: Iafceeaed872192c2c4d2101d05ad68183b60ee49
"}]
commit_message:
ML2 can't seem to load type drivers

fixes bug: 1221781

When ML2 plugin is initialized using Devstack, jsonrpclib is not
installed. This prevents some type drivers from starting up.

A fix is introduced such that when ML2 plugin is configured using
devstack, jsonroplib is installed. This package needs to be installed
only on the server node. Hence the package is installed in routine
neutron_plugin_configure_service().
Initially, it is used by Arista mechanism driver.
In future, it may be used by other drivers as well.

Change-Id: Iafceeaed872192c2c4d2101d05ad68183b60ee49

commit_message:
VlanManager creates superfluous quota reservations

The VlanManager does not enforce quotas on fixed IPs because it
allocates an entire network to a project. However the process
of deallocating an IP address still creates an entry in the
reservations table.

The VlanManager now loads the NoopQuotaDriver and no longer
writes superflously to the database.

Change-Id: Idf95085a5c1f4e71f3f0fc92618607073602eed3
Fixes: Bug #1204714
(cherry picked from commit 0224bca0cf0a159b096633c776d14279e33a5730)

commit_message:
Adds hypervisor support for Nova V3 API

Adds support and tests for the os-hypervisors extension
for the Nova V3 API.

Note that compared to the V2 API it separates the search
function into search by hypervisor name and a new list
servers by hypervisor as this better first the changes
in the V3 API. The listing of servers by hypervisor command
is preserved, though reworked to use the new interfaces.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: I472f9acad895dcf842e93d2de27530652f73867e

commit_message:
Adds second part of quotas support for Nova V3 API

Adds support and tests for the os-quota-class-sets
extension for the Nova V3 API. Note that compared to
the V2 version this removes the ability to set quotas
which are not relevant to the V3 API (eg injected file
quotas are not relevant because the os-personalities
extension has been removed).

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: I3e7f36407f2f59737ecbce2c8ce014cef623ecdc

subject: Ensure we are not exhausting the sqlalchemy pool
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-20 16:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Ensure we are not exhausting the sqlalchemy pool

Because of eventlet, notification messages can be consumed more quickly
that than they are wroted to the database, this have to effect to exhaust
the sqlalchemy connection pool and raise:

TimeoutError: QueuePool limit of size 5 overflow 10 reached, connection
timed out, timeout 30

The patch creates a eventlet pool to ensure that the pool never exhausts
and prints a warning message in the log to inform that perhaps the pool
size need to be increased.

Fixes bug #1243251

Change-Id: I5ccdc141c441db32fab361783a31a96015516878
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure we are not exhausting the sqlalchemy pool

Because of eventlet, notification messages can be consumed more quickly
that than they are wroted to the database, this have to effect to exhaust
the sqlalchemy connection pool and raise:

TimeoutError: QueuePool limit of size 5 overflow 10 reached, connection
timed out, timeout 30

The patch creates a eventlet pool to ensure that the pool never exhausts
and prints a warning message in the log to inform that perhaps the pool
size need to be increased.

Fixes bug #1243251

Change-Id: I5ccdc141c441db32fab361783a31a96015516878

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-11-27 18:14:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/fakes.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/compute/cells_api.py', 'nova/network/api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "Check Neutron port quota during validate_networks in API

Unless ports are passed into Nova it will create ports on the
requested networks as part of the network allocation in
the compute manager. However if the user exceeds their
port quota the instance will end up in an Error state, having
first been re-scheduled a number of times.

It would be much better if the quota failure was detected as
part of the network validation in the API server, so that an
error can be reported to the user and the creation failed.

A full fix would include reserving or creating the ports at
this stage, but there is no reservation mechanism in the
Neutron API, and port creation depends in some cases
on mac addresses only available on the compute manager.

Instead this change just validates the quota and adjusts the
max_count to be consistent with that quota, which doesn't
guarantee that the create will work, but does catch the
majority of cases.

Refs bug: 1172808

Change-Id: Iaaee059a6746fad68049712f94b2f8cfea6ab8dc
"}]
commit_message:
Check Neutron port quota during validate_networks in API

Unless ports are passed into Nova it will create ports on the
requested networks as part of the network allocation in
the compute manager. However if the user exceeds their
port quota the instance will end up in an Error state, having
first been re-scheduled a number of times.

It would be much better if the quota failure was detected as
part of the network validation in the API server, so that an
error can be reported to the user and the creation failed.

A full fix would include reserving or creating the ports at
this stage, but there is no reservation mechanism in the
Neutron API, and port creation depends in some cases
on mac addresses only available on the compute manager.

Instead this change just validates the quota and adjusts the
max_count to be consistent with that quota, which doesn't
guarantee that the create will work, but does catch the
majority of cases.

Refs bug: 1172808

Change-Id: Iaaee059a6746fad68049712f94b2f8cfea6ab8dc

commit_message:
List NotImplementedError as a client exception for vnc

Not all drivers implement the get_vnc_console method.  In that case,
they will raise NotImplementedError.  List this exception as a client
exception so that the rpc layer does not log a traceback when this
happens.

Change-Id: Id30fd35b36cbd222b2d8787f00fa586d1ed4f11a

subject: Stops file descriptor leaking in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 16:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/environment/eventlet_server.py'], 'message': 'Stops file descriptor leaking in tests

During a test run serveral hundred WSGI servers are started, used for a
single testcase and then stopped. We were not properly killing the
greenthread in cases where we started the server, but the thread had not
started.

The problem is that a greenthead evaluates True or False depending if it
has already started running. We really just need a check to make sure
start() was called on the server. In this patch if server.greenthread is
not None that means that the server was started.

There are still other places where descriptors are leaking.

Change-Id: I06cddb97553cb2d25b7d0447634f05e2f6b163fe
'}]
commit_message:
Stops file descriptor leaking in tests

During a test run serveral hundred WSGI servers are started, used for a
single testcase and then stopped. We were not properly killing the
greenthread in cases where we started the server, but the thread had not
started.

The problem is that a greenthead evaluates True or False depending if it
has already started running. We really just need a check to make sure
start() was called on the server. In this patch if server.greenthread is
not None that means that the server was started.

There are still other places where descriptors are leaking.

Change-Id: I06cddb97553cb2d25b7d0447634f05e2f6b163fe

commit_message:
Install Guide: Clarify database node setup

Some people were not aware that they needed to install MySQL packages
on nodes. This patch rearranges the code so that we have separate
sections for controller and node and thus readers should easily
spot what needs to be done.

Change-Id: I104b949466b426e102d55bcb3c4a9cb72a0a6af9
Closes-Bug: #1250600

commit_message:
Document security group when using ML2 plugin

Since the ML2 plugin can concurrently support different L2 agents (or
other mechanisms) with different configurations, Neutron developpers
recommend setting firewall_driver flag in ml2 configuration.

Change-Id: I7f97128a955ded99400e25a5ef9a990260df3bf7
Closes-bug: #1262678
backport: havana
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 19:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': "sync oslo service to fix SIGHUP handling

this is a sync of the oslo service code to fix a bug found in
the sighup handling. Previously it was not possible to use
devstack's unstack.sh because the service module would always
restart under a SIGHUP, not only when the process was running as
a service. SIGHUP on a non-detached process should act like

Change-Id: Ib260d82519fde5c5cb24a2c0c8a7cccd0b96b84f
Related-Bug: #1263122
"}]
commit_message:
sync oslo service to fix SIGHUP handling

this is a sync of the oslo service code to fix a bug found in
the sighup handling. Previously it was not possible to use
devstack's unstack.sh because the service module would always
restart under a SIGHUP, not only when the process was running as
a service. SIGHUP on a non-detached process should act like
SIGTERM. This change fixes that.

Change-Id: Ib260d82519fde5c5cb24a2c0c8a7cccd0b96b84f
Related-Bug: #1263122

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-05 14:53:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/229_add_extra_resources_in_compute_nodes.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Add extra_resources field to compute_nodes table

The compute_nodes table has informtion about allocation and
availability of a predefined set of resources (e.g. memory,
disk, vcpu). The extra_resources field will contain a json
string of arbirtrary information describing an extensible set
of resources that will be tracked by resource tracker plug-ins.

This differs from other fields containing json strings that have
been added recently, including pci_stats and metrics. In particular,
pci_stats is used for information about pci devices, whereas metrics
contains continuously monitored usage data and is updated at different
times to extra_resources and according to a different trigger.

Change-Id: I75e339c2a2827875078c937e57c37e85d3ad1852

commit_message:
Add extra_resources field to compute_nodes table

The compute_nodes table has informtion about allocation and
availability of a predefined set of resources (e.g. memory,
disk, vcpu). The extra_resources field will contain a json
string of arbirtrary information describing an extensible set
of resources that will be tracked by resource tracker plug-ins.

This differs from other fields containing json strings that have
been added recently, including pci_stats and metrics. In particular,
pci_stats is used for information about pci devices, whereas metrics
contains continuously monitored usage data and is updated at different
times to extra_resources and according to a different trigger.
Accordingly, it makes sense to seperate these into different fields.

This is part of: blueprint extensible-resource-tracking

Change-Id: I75e339c2a2827875078c937e57c37e85d3ad1852

commit_message:
Add Event API

This commit adds v2/event_types, v2/events and
v2/events/*/traits. Currently, the event api is
limited to admin users, but is configurable in
the policy.json file. All users that are able to
access the event api can view all events in the
system, it is not restricted per project id.
Operators other than 'eq' have not yet been
implemented.

This change re-names the parameters in the
event_filter to class so they are more
end-user friendly.

implements bp specify-event-api

Change-Id: I0ccd4ef81cac5f8f57a450dc980ea85ff8fe89ec

subject: Re-write comment for ADMIN_TOKEN
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-20 04:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Re-write comment for ADMIN_TOKEN

It seems that there is a misconception around the ADMIN_TOKEN in
keystone. Currently the comment read that it is a "shared secret"
and can be used between openstack services.

However this token has no user associated with it, and no
authorization. It's a method to bootstrap into keystone, that's
all.

Closes-Bug: 1261622
Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6c913a8079bb84b56ac69249e7d25bc94cf32dd0
'}]
commit_message:
Re-write comment for ADMIN_TOKEN

It seems that there is a misconception around the ADMIN_TOKEN in
keystone. Currently the comment read that it is a "shared secret"
and can be used between openstack services.

However this token has no user associated with it, and no
authorization. It's a method to bootstrap into keystone, that's
all.

Closes-Bug: 1261622
Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6c913a8079bb84b56ac69249e7d25bc94cf32dd0

commit_message:
Move Assignment Controllers and Routers to be First Class

The assignment and identity controllers and routers have been intermixed
since they were the same subsystem. The split of Identity and Assignment
at the manager level has completed.

This change continues the process and makes the Assignment controllers
and router definitions part of the assignment subsystem instead of part
of Identity. In part, this is also a continuation of clarifying where domain
lookups (for per-domain-identity backend logic) occurs.

Identity maintains a simple subclass-proxy of each Controller that was
moved to maintain compatibility for clean deprecation until Icehouse
has been released and development opens up for J.

bp: assignment-controller-first-class
bp: deprecated-as-of-icehouse
related-bug: #1218094
Change-Id: If9a206692704005284e619679e1b6fe8b08bf8c9

subject: Remove Identity and Assignment controller interdependancies
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-17 00:33:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/credential/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/identity/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_credential.py', 'keystone/credential/core.py'], 'message': 'Remove Identity and Assignment controller interdependancies

The DomainV3 controller explicitly instantiated the UserV3, GroupV3
and ProjectV3 controllers to call some delete methods. This makes it
very difficult to isolate the controllers from each other and
incorrectly implemented some logic that should exist in the
credential_api.

The code for deleting credentials by project and by user is now
implemented on the credential_api. This allows the controllers
to directly ask the credential_api to perform the deletes (and
in the case of the SQL backend, perform a more efficient delete
process).

The DomainV3 controller properly uses the identity_api to cleanup
users and groups when deletion occurs. Likewise, DomainV3 controller
now properly calls the assignment_api to perform project deletions.

These changes have been done to aid in clarifying explicit uses of
the per-domain-identity backend logic.

bp: assignment-controller-first-class
related-bug: #1218094
Change-Id: Ie8ed8bce556fe2f41cc7db61f04eefaf14f836f1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Identity and Assignment controller interdependancies

The DomainV3 controller explicitly instantiated the UserV3, GroupV3
and ProjectV3 controllers to call some delete methods. This makes it
very difficult to isolate the controllers from each other and
incorrectly implemented some logic that should exist in the
credential_api.

The code for deleting credentials by project and by user is now
implemented on the credential_api. This allows the controllers
to directly ask the credential_api to perform the deletes (and
in the case of the SQL backend, perform a more efficient delete
process).

The DomainV3 controller properly uses the identity_api to cleanup
users and groups when deletion occurs. Likewise, DomainV3 controller
now properly calls the assignment_api to perform project deletions.

These changes have been done to aid in clarifying explicit uses of
the per-domain-identity backend logic.

bp: assignment-controller-first-class
related-bug: #1218094
Change-Id: Ie8ed8bce556fe2f41cc7db61f04eefaf14f836f1

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-18 14:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_ports.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Add 'next' link when GET maximum number of items

When GET'ing items from a collection with no limit parameter specified
in the request, the API gets the limit value from the configuration file
(default is max_limit=1000). However, in the case where there are more
than max_limit items, the API was not returning a 'next' link to retrieve
the next subset of items.

It turns out that the max_limit value wasn't being passed to the
*Collection.convert_with_links method. This fixes that issue by moving
the collection call into the same method that determines the limit value.

Change-Id: I81e734a951e4025f64a5d572656d627e4126b353
Closes-Bug: #1250804
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'next' link when GET maximum number of items

When GET'ing items from a collection with no limit parameter specified
in the request, the API gets the limit value from the configuration file
(default is max_limit=1000). However, in the case where there are more
than max_limit items, the API was not returning a 'next' link to retrieve
the next subset of items.

It turns out that the max_limit value wasn't being passed to the
*Collection.convert_with_links method. This fixes that issue by moving
the collection call into the same method that determines the limit value.

Change-Id: I81e734a951e4025f64a5d572656d627e4126b353
Closes-Bug: #1250804

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-13 13:30:21.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/vs_port.rb'], 'message': 'fix: properly pass the sleep parameter

There is no need to call “super” here. This patch avoid the following
error:

Validate method failed for class sleep:

  implicit argument passing of super from method defined by
  define_method() is not supported. Specify all arguments explicitly.

Closes-Bug: #1260732

Change-Id: Ic4d0a94be5104eb468d10f3d383eaa4d1fbc31d1
'}]
commit_message:
fix: properly pass the sleep parameter

There is no need to call “super” here. This patch avoid the following
error:

Validate method failed for class sleep:

  implicit argument passing of super from method defined by
  define_method() is not supported. Specify all arguments explicitly.

Closes-Bug: #1260732

Change-Id: Ic4d0a94be5104eb468d10f3d383eaa4d1fbc31d1

commit_message:
Create swift operator keystone roles

Defining operator_roles in swift-proxy.conf requires
that these roles exist in keystone.

Because Keystone API access is not available on Swift
proxy hosts in most cases, operator_roles keystone
roles have been added to swift::keystone::auth class.

Added basic docs for swift::keystone::auth

Change-Id: Ib8454f8ae1316d2589ff228ec1424c6cff69c6b5
Closes-Bug: #1261662

commit_message:
horizon replaced nodejs by a python alternative

since commit a0739c9423a4c559b45af96fa4cdb30539dcdbd7 and the Havana
release, horizon uses a pure Python alternative to nodejs.

Horizon changed the way to use the compress utility, the option
offline_compress is no longer available.
Thanks to Maxime Vidori for the information.

Change-Id: Ie290701b00c97352838e13182b940a6de46a591f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6722, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo(gcb)', 'email': 'guochbo@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'guochbo'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-12-20 20:52:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': "Add docstring for exception handlers of session

In code review, some projects are using try/except within the
context managed by session. That's wrong, add the note in
docstring, hope others put try/except in right place.

Database Errors like IntegrityError will be raised in session's
__exit__ handler, and any try/except within the context managed
by session will not be triggered. And catching other non-database
errors in the session will not trigger the ROLLBACK, so exception
handlers should always be outside the session, except developer
want to commit parts of stuff on purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1262065

Change-Id: I23223fbe9b6d9fa8e92e59894fb3b1fa195be159
"}]
commit_message:
Add docstring for exception handlers of session

In code review, some projects are using try/except within the
context managed by session. That's wrong, add the note in
docstring, hope others put try/except in right place.

Database Errors like IntegrityError will be raised in session's
__exit__ handler, and any try/except within the context managed
by session will not be triggered. And catching other non-database
errors in the session will not trigger the ROLLBACK, so exception
handlers should always be outside the session, except developer
want to commit parts of stuff on purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1262065

Change-Id: I23223fbe9b6d9fa8e92e59894fb3b1fa195be159

commit_message:
Address splinters performance by having two settings instead of one.

vlan_spliters will not create a hard trunk list, it will only enable
 the vlan splinters work around in OVS

vlan_splinters_trunks will enable OVS flag and will create hard trunk
 list. This may be necessary in some deployments.

This also needs https://review.openstack.org/62513 for the UI option
 to support setting.

Closes-Bug: #1257604

Change-Id: Id034a98e10eee8e8ba9af2de0bd36aa199e2db02
