commit_message:
Added steps to upgrade and reboot system after adding OpenStack repos

After adding the OpenStack repos, several distributions need to
upgrade additional packages and sometimes this includes the kernel.
Rebooting also guarantees that all changes will take effect.  I
attempted to cover all distributions with this patch.

Change-Id: I97fbf8f9ce3ff8a403ccbd90f1b0c38d915d9369
Closes-Bug: #1258279
(cherry picked from commit a31e3b9400f40d8c225f109c7c0c718b872c129b)

commit_message:
moving to global lazy loaded config

one of the problems we've got with tempest is the fact that config
loading is tied into the class hierarchy. However there is no
reason why it should be. If we instead create a config proxy
object we can lazy load the actual config when we are executing,
and not do it at import time.

This could use future iteration, but it does a huge job in
removing config from the object inheritance tree which massively
simplifies our ability to use config variables throughout the code.

Change-Id: I9b1bbfe231c85c01938bd68be4e5974bd24130d6

commit_message:
Allow resizes and migrates during live upgrade

This patch completes the changes needed to havana's compute rpc api to
allow live upgrades to icehouse.  Specifically, these changes are needed
to allow resizes and migrates to work.  Before havana compute nodes get
put in a mixed environment with icehouse compute nodes, they need to be
speaking version 3.0 messages.

Change-Id: If09bd38c9d8c3beb5b95107c497699dec47aa3ef
Closes-bug: #1258253

subject: Allow compute manager to accept 3.0 messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-05 21:56:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Allow compute manager to accept 3.0 messages

We are currently trying to support live upgrades from havana to
icehouse.  This change is required to make that happen.  In a live
upgrade situation, you have icehouse nova infrastructure, with a mix of
havana and icehouse compute nodes as you roll through and upgrade them.
While in this situation, the havana compute nodes must be able to accept
3.0 messages.

Accepting 3.0 messages is trivial to do and extremely low risk.  It does
not change the behavior of a havana-only deployment at all.  The only
additions is some pass-through code to the current compute manager.
This code will only get hit during a live upgrade situation.

Note that there is one other change needed to complete this.  With only
this patch, live upgrades are supported, but any operations that require
compute nodes to talk to each other will not work.  This includes
resizes and migrates.  That would be unfortunate, since live migrations
are something that people *definitely* want to be able to do during an
upgrade procedure.

The additional changes needed to allow resizes and migrates during live
upgrades are included in another patch.

Partial-bug: #1258253
Change-Id: Ia801609b6b3fe88e0d0b16f4c0d37bf25dbfa842
'}]
commit_message:
Allow compute manager to accept 3.0 messages

We are currently trying to support live upgrades from havana to
icehouse.  This change is required to make that happen.  In a live
upgrade situation, you have icehouse nova infrastructure, with a mix of
havana and icehouse compute nodes as you roll through and upgrade them.
While in this situation, the havana compute nodes must be able to accept
3.0 messages.

Accepting 3.0 messages is trivial to do and extremely low risk.  It does
not change the behavior of a havana-only deployment at all.  The only
additions is some pass-through code to the current compute manager.
This code will only get hit during a live upgrade situation.

Note that there is one other change needed to complete this.  With only
this patch, live upgrades are supported, but any operations that require
compute nodes to talk to each other will not work.  This includes
resizes and migrates.  That would be unfortunate, since live migrations
are something that people *definitely* want to be able to do during an
upgrade procedure.

The additional changes needed to allow resizes and migrates during live
upgrades are included in another patch.

Partial-bug: #1258253
Change-Id: Ia801609b6b3fe88e0d0b16f4c0d37bf25dbfa842

subject: Fix interprocess locks when running unit-tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-19 16:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/conf_fixture.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix interprocess locks when running unit-tests

When running unit-tests concurrently using testr, we might
need to use interprocess file locks (e.g. for running various
tests using the same DB in MySQL/PostgreSQL).

At the same time file locks are only usable when they are placed
to one dir, and we have a test fixture that overrides the lock_path
config value for each test case with a new temporary directory.

The solution is to create the one temprorary directory for locks
to be used by all tests before running tests and then remove it
after running tests. The corresponding helper has been already
put to openstack.common.lockutils module, we just need to reuse
it properly, i.e. change the way unit tests are run in tox.ini.

Closes-Bug: #1261728

Change-Id: I76f95a9f7fdd31c15e6cf4fd6316c7569284f780
'}]
commit_message:
Fix interprocess locks when running unit-tests

When running unit-tests concurrently using testr, we might
need to use interprocess file locks (e.g. for running various
tests using the same DB in MySQL/PostgreSQL).

At the same time file locks are only usable when they are placed
to one dir, and we have a test fixture that overrides the lock_path
config value for each test case with a new temporary directory.

The solution is to create the one temprorary directory for locks
to be used by all tests before running tests and then remove it
after running tests. The corresponding helper has been already
put to openstack.common.lockutils module, we just need to reuse
it properly, i.e. change the way unit tests are run in tox.ini.

Closes-Bug: #1261728

Change-Id: I76f95a9f7fdd31c15e6cf4fd6316c7569284f780

subject: Specify source file encoding as UTF-8

This setting specifies how build plugins and IDEs should treat files
in the project. If it is not specified, then the editor default for
file creation and editing, and the build system default for analyzing

setting is necessary to ensure that the project behaves the same way

'}]
commit_message:
Specify source file encoding as UTF-8

This setting specifies how build plugins and IDEs should treat files
in the project. If it is not specified, then the editor default for
file creation and editing, and the build system default for analyzing
content, defaults to the default encoding of the current system. The
setting is necessary to ensure that the project behaves the same way
across all operating systems and locales.

Change-Id: Ifee72b31276f96b0def13a897f8baaca28e9c5ed

commit_message:
Use six.seraise() instead of `raise exc, val, tb`

Python 3 doesent support odl `raise exception, value, traceback` syntax,
so we should use six.reraise() to make code compatible with python 3.

Related to blueprint make-python3-compatible

Change-Id: If66983d94667a3d3b0e809d4c0767b0829394f67

`ascii_lowercase` instead of it.

Related to blueprint make-python3-compatible

commit_message:
fileutils: do not hardcode /tmp usage

It's actually not always /tmp on all operating systems, especially if
the TMPDIR environment variable is set.

Change-Id: I9bc67769a39535dfeafe8c60aa63792e21ac9703

This is a bit frustrating at the moment as you don't project specific
error messages when a test fails (it only shows the oslo logging messages).

By removing the 'openstack.common', we get all logs.

commit_message:
Rename create_test_server to create_server

Because BaseComputeTest.create_test_server has the pattern "test"
in the name, the nose test runner tries to run it as a test. As
a result, the test gets run once for every ttime a test that
inherits from BaseComputeTest or its subclasses is run.

Change-Id: I102406d8a2a02dfc6f29da40aec86e692f365ad7
Closes-Bug: #1263206

commit_message:
Merge openstack/common/service.py for bug 1263122

disable SIGHUP restart behavior in foreground

SIGHUP should only be a restart action for a daemonized processs,
when used on a console process SIGHUP should == SIGTERM. Add
detection for whether this service is actually daemonized.

Change-Id: I2a73d3872a302fcfac1a6ee844a44faa9569b3dd
Fixes-Bug: 1263122

commit_message:
Fix PowerDNS not using recordset_id

When updating domains on server create, the PowerDNS backend didn't use
the designate_recordset_id field, despite it being present in the
schema.

Change-Id: Icef2612058b3af3bd0b9136a0fffddb336fb0e03
Closes-Bug: 1262837

revisions:

Comment in "Attach Volumes to instances" ("Manage volumes" section), in
order to inform that device name may not match the one proposed by the user.
This limitation is related to hypervisor settings.
The documentation of this issue was recommended by John Griffith in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60257/

commit_message:
Comment related to device name in attach volumes

Comment in "Attach Volumes to instances" ("Manage volumes" section), in
order to inform that device name may not match the one proposed by the user.
This limitation is related to hypervisor settings.
The documentation of this issue was recommended by John Griffith in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60257/

backport: havana
Related-Bug: #1217874

Change-Id: Ifa65ec6eecca23e85786b0fd79ae3b8ef8ebd537

commit_message:
Allow running of proxy and storage on the same node.

This adds conditionals to support a installation
in which a user desires to run both swift proxy and
storage on the same node.

Change-Id: I0cc827525968a9d1dc836c553a39f0ac13c4667e
(cherry picked from commit af129f0a93009293dba610ee487a41fb15027336)

subject: Calculate partition power for swift
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-12-20 18:57:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/lib/puppet/parser/functions/calc_ring_part_power.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_ha.pp'], 'message': "Calculate partition power for swift

Calculage partition power according to
https://answers.launchpad.net/swift/+question/211929

power = int(log2(devnumber*100)) + resize_factor

resize_factor can be set in $::fuel_settings['swift'] hash.
default value: 2 (2048 partitions in standard setup)

Change-Id: Icbc518b05f8170b8656b6aad701bf3cece89f74f
Related-bug: #1261659
"}]
commit_message:
Calculate partition power for swift

Calculage partition power according to
https://answers.launchpad.net/swift/+question/211929

power = int(log2(devnumber*100)) + resize_factor

resize_factor can be set in $::fuel_settings['swift'] hash.
default value: 2 (2048 partitions in standard setup)

Change-Id: Icbc518b05f8170b8656b6aad701bf3cece89f74f
Related-bug: #1261659

subject: Adding additional tests for novaclient ssh
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-20 09:18:20.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Adding additional tests for novaclient ssh

There's a few gaps in the testing regime for do_ssh, specifically
around IPv6, specifying identity files, and additional args. This
patch attempts to address these.

Change-Id: I590fd7ffe1e3470c8507d7f7fb2abcfdb6162561
"}]
commit_message:
Adding additional tests for novaclient ssh

There's a few gaps in the testing regime for do_ssh, specifically
around IPv6, specifying identity files, and additional args. This
patch attempts to address these.

Change-Id: I590fd7ffe1e3470c8507d7f7fb2abcfdb6162561

commit_message:
Fixes get_vm_storage_paths issue for Hyper-V V2 API

Add get_vm_storage_paths function to vmutilsv2.py

get_vm_storage_paths implementation on Hyper-V V2 API changed
compared to previous V1 API. In previous V1 APIs, using
Msvm_ResourceAllocationSettingData class can get storage
paths, but in V2 API, only using Msvm_StorageAllocationSettingData
class can get the storage paths.

Closes-Bug: #1248463

Change-Id: Ica73221524f162a6ffcd9dc64ee33c85fb5ad31d

commit_message:
LVM migration: Check if name is equal to dest_vg

The existence check of the destination volume group is wrong. It
currently checks if there's a VG with a name equal to the source's vg
name instead of checking if it's equal to the dest_vg.

Closes-bug: #1258203
(cherry picked from commit 17912f4c4fba270a15cab47bb68d9e30c34a69b0)

Change-Id: Ia5d4acb24b94c6aa832107c7eb4b6996985af97f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7040, 'name': 'GuoHui LIu', 'email': 'liuguohui@gmail.com', 'username': 'guohliu'}, {'_account_id': 7203, 'name': 'yuuichi fujioka', 'email': 'fujioka.yuuichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'FujiokaYuuichi'}, {'_account_id': 7882, 'name': 'Yuiko Takada Mori', 'email': 'yuiko-mori@nec.com', 'username': 'YuikoTakada'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-12-20 10:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_quotas.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_quota_classes.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_quota_sets.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quota_classes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_classes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_sets.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quotas.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_quota_classes.py'], 'message': 'Fix parameter checking about quota update api

In quota_classes and quotas update API, parameters are checked
whether they are integer or not.
But when pass float values to these APIs, error doesn't occur.
Float values should be forbidden for the following reasons.
(1)If the value that user submitted and the value registered
   actually are different, user will be confused.
(2)Error messages of these APIs are "...must be integer...".
(3)In horizon, if a float is submitted, error message is displayed.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I4c7df52ffff2d997da4e6267e25ec2ea4ab6f153
Closes-Bug: #1243037
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parameter checking about quota update api

In quota_classes and quotas update API, parameters are checked
whether they are integer or not.
But when pass float values to these APIs, error doesn't occur.
Float values should be forbidden for the following reasons.
(1)If the value that user submitted and the value registered
   actually are different, user will be confused.
(2)Error messages of these APIs are "...must be integer...".
(3)In horizon, if a float is submitted, error message is displayed.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I4c7df52ffff2d997da4e6267e25ec2ea4ab6f153
Closes-Bug: #1243037

commit_message:
update script should install released oslo.config

the update.sh script was still referencing a beta release off the
tarballs site, which ensured you were getting a terribly old
oslo.config. We should use a real version of oslo.config to do
updates.

Change-Id: Ia7a2c3d8e22d1d5d6afc01150ec87f3d54778606

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-20 08:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_action_engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/executor.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py'], 'message': 'Refactor engine internals

In this change we:
- introduce single graph action, that works with futures
- split methods of TaskAction into schedule/complete parts,
  with schedule* returns future;
- task executor became entity that manages Executor, instead
  of engine + graph action.

Change-Id: Ic0704534391abdd566bf2d87adabef43a9c88cfb
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor engine internals

In this change we:
- introduce single graph action, that works with futures
- split methods of TaskAction into schedule/complete parts,
  with schedule* returns future;
- task executor became entity that manages Executor, instead
  of engine + graph action.

Change-Id: Ic0704534391abdd566bf2d87adabef43a9c88cfb

commit_message:
Fixed naming of expected status of a stack.

Method wait_for_stack_status in heatmanager
was waiting for "ERROR" status as reason
for test interruption but should wait
for "CREATE_FAILED" status.
Similar fix was done in cleanup.py.

Change-Id: Ib9fb5c3df3256328012d23a56bd4f78923724c6c
Closes-Bug: #1260798

commit_message:
Remove configuration usage from executors

Starting with this patch, the executors will not receive any
configuration object, but instead keyword arguments containing possible
options that should be passed down to them.

For compatibility reason, for now, the whole configuration object from
the transport is used, since the latter still uses it.

Blueprint: messaging-decouple-cfg

Change-Id: I9b92b0d98d316ba0be99404d217b5a230e1b3429

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-12 21:32:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot.py', 'doc/source/template_guide/hot_spec.rst'], 'message': 'Adds parameter_groups to HOT specification.

The ability to group and order parameters in the template is
currently missing. This patch allows for a new section of the
template, parameter_groups, to be added by the template author
to explicitly define the expected behavior.

Change-Id: I6d8dc4e6490fbfe9cc45f6ca9cb1ac2826e13273
Implements: blueprint parameter-grouping-ordering
'}]
commit_message:
Adds parameter_groups to HOT specification.

The ability to group and order parameters in the template is
currently missing. This patch allows for a new section of the
template, parameter_groups, to be added by the template author
to explicitly define the expected behavior.

Change-Id: I6d8dc4e6490fbfe9cc45f6ca9cb1ac2826e13273
Implements: blueprint parameter-grouping-ordering

now log the repotype, for debugging purposes.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-20 14:48:37.000000000', 'files': ['elements/source-repositories/README.md', 'elements/source-repositories/extra-data.d/98-source-repositories'], 'message': 'Improve source-repositories git caching.

We now unconditionally cache the repositories being fetched with
source-repositories.

Additionally, by improving the way we handle repository refs, we are now
able to build images with code taken directly from gerrit reviews.

Change-Id: Ifd4c5691f6761eb5551663e6d0aa1c0e42afced3
'}]
commit_message:
Improve source-repositories git caching.

We now unconditionally cache the repositories being fetched with
source-repositories.

Additionally, by improving the way we handle repository refs, we are now
able to build images with code taken directly from gerrit reviews.

Change-Id: Ifd4c5691f6761eb5551663e6d0aa1c0e42afced3

subject: Add sleep to search_for function, so that node can be searched
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-17 09:11:12.000000000', 'files': ['libraries/search.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add sleep to search_for function, so that node can be searched

Because Chef server build node index need some time, so when a node is
bootstrapped, it takes some time before it is searchable. So I added a
timeout for Chef building node index.

Closes-bug: 1208201
Change-Id: I55eb383ce98e4765c412ece799f7885e690ab188
'}]
commit_message:
Add sleep to search_for function, so that node can be searched

Because Chef server build node index need some time, so when a node is
bootstrapped, it takes some time before it is searchable. So I added a
timeout for Chef building node index.

Closes-bug: 1208201
Change-Id: I55eb383ce98e4765c412ece799f7885e690ab188

commit_message:
Add reference to isolated hosts-iso image restrict

Havana added a new parameter, which is already documented,
that alters the IsolatedHostsSchedule so that IsolatedHosts
can run only Isolated images. This patch adds a sentence
explaining this.

Change-Id: I26d1fe3d3daab4df944f0d9f83e940f953fe1c81
Closes-Bug: 1208526

Add note about windows image timezone

As per the bug report, if you don't set os_type=windows
during upload, bad things happen. This patch adds a note
that says as such.

Change-Id: I0ef2136b4d9e0af56afac62ce5aac8671e03f6cb
Closes-Bug: 1239828

commit_message:
Added steps to upgrade and reboot system after adding OpenStack repos

After adding the OpenStack repos, several distributions need to
upgrade additional packages and sometimes this includes the kernel.
Rebooting also guarantees that all changes will take effect.  I
attempted to cover all distributions with this patch.

Change-Id: I97fbf8f9ce3ff8a403ccbd90f1b0c38d915d9369
Closes-Bug: #1258279

commit_message:
Create volume group when use the LVMISCSIDriver

Create volume group when set volume_driver to
cinder.volume.drivers.lvm.LVMISCSIDriver otherwise we can not create
volume with cinder.

Change-Id: I9d27a19254aa62130c13171d68c0c67e4e3686ce

commit_message:
Increase timeout for Ambari server setup

The setup might take more then 5 minutes (current limit) if JRE is not
pre-installed on the image and the Internet connection is slow. This
change increases the timeout to half an hour.

Partially fixes bug #1259836

Change-Id: I41279f965c5e7d8c41e1edb800b3e62d38537bb7

subject: Removal of _REPOSITORY global variable.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-19 15:12:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_migration_common.py'], 'message': 'Removal of _REPOSITORY global variable.

Oslo.db migration.py uses global variable to store defined
`migrate.versioning.repository.Repository` instance containing migration
repository path. At first _find_migrate_repo(repo_path) call the return value
will be stored in a global variable. So all subsequent calls
will return the existing global variable value regardless of repo_path
value passed. This design makes impossible to have multiple migration
repositories in the same project.
Detected at syncing of Keystone with Oslo.db.

Change-Id: If6187a0f7c4590e1c2cd4d998b25ee90aeac17dc
Closes-Bug: #1259229
'}]
commit_message:
Removal of _REPOSITORY global variable.

Oslo.db migration.py uses global variable to store defined
`migrate.versioning.repository.Repository` instance containing migration
repository path. At first _find_migrate_repo(repo_path) call the return value
will be stored in a global variable. So all subsequent calls
will return the existing global variable value regardless of repo_path
value passed. This design makes impossible to have multiple migration
repositories in the same project.
Detected at syncing of Keystone with Oslo.db.

Change-Id: If6187a0f7c4590e1c2cd4d998b25ee90aeac17dc
Closes-Bug: #1259229

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-17 09:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/api.py', 'tests/unit/db/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Remove eventlet tpool from common db.api

There is only one place in oslo.db where we use eventlet - wrapping of
DB API method calls to be executed by tpool threads.
It makes sense to remove this feature from oslo.db code and
use the tpool.Proxy() wrapper in the db.api module in each project.

blueprint oslo-db-lib

POC in Nova - Id7de85dce11f5ea61dfccddf80de7800a2bc4e37

Change-Id: I6fa140f2b1f03c43ae7cab98ac8a12d71188af76
'}]
commit_message:
Remove eventlet tpool from common db.api

There is only one place in oslo.db where we use eventlet - wrapping of
DB API method calls to be executed by tpool threads.
It makes sense to remove this feature from oslo.db code and
use the tpool.Proxy() wrapper in the db.api module in each project.

blueprint oslo-db-lib

POC in Nova - Id7de85dce11f5ea61dfccddf80de7800a2bc4e37

Change-Id: I6fa140f2b1f03c43ae7cab98ac8a12d71188af76

commit_message:
Adds first part of quotas support for Nova V3 API

Adds support and tests for the os-quotas extension
for the Nova V3 API. Note that compared to the V2
version this removes the ability to set quotas
which are not relevant to the V3 API (eg injected
file quotas are not relevant because the
os-personalities extension has been removed)

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: Ifa1c77428424bedf7fb88ef6d7b3843376799d24

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-19 20:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/base.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_hbase.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_log.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_db2.py'], 'message': "storage: factorize not implemented methods

There's a lot of driver that are not implementing everything, and as
time goes by, this is getting and going to be more and more common. Not

"}]
commit_message:
storage: factorize not implemented methods

There's a lot of driver that are not implementing everything, and as
time goes by, this is getting and going to be more and more common. Not
all drivers are suited to do everything, so implementing every methods
as abstract makes a lot of NotImplementedError raising redundant.

This patch makes stop using that and remove a lot of useless copy pasted
code.

Change-Id: I9e48c4f0484033061a3c3461d761e4cea4b8e75e

subject: Remove debug specific handling
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-20 03:48:26.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/shell.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/test_http.py', 'keystoneclient/httpclient.py', 'keystoneclient/session.py'], 'message': "Remove debug specific handling

I think debug handling was initially done this way for CLI handling
where we wanted to make sure only the correct information was printed to
the console. However as logging.basicConfig sets up a stream handler on
the root logging object I can't see any purpose to the debug handling in
the actual HTTPClient. Further than this it is completely wrong that a
client library is messing with it's logging level, this should be handled
by an application.

The debug flag is maintained and deprecated in HTTPClient and removed
from the session object. There has been no release since the addition of
session so there is no problem with compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib00f3d93d099ed1a9dd25f17121610a7289f0061
"}]
commit_message:
Remove debug specific handling

I think debug handling was initially done this way for CLI handling
where we wanted to make sure only the correct information was printed to
the console. However as logging.basicConfig sets up a stream handler on
the root logging object I can't see any purpose to the debug handling in
the actual HTTPClient. Further than this it is completely wrong that a
client library is messing with it's logging level, this should be handled
by an application.

The debug flag is maintained and deprecated in HTTPClient and removed
from the session object. There has been no release since the addition of
session so there is no problem with compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib00f3d93d099ed1a9dd25f17121610a7289f0061

Now user can locate OS partition on any of available

commit_message:
Made small improvement for Ubuntu partitioning.

Now user can locate OS partition on any of available
disks on node. But there is still the limitation that
OS volume group MUST be located on one disk. It is
because we do not use LVM for OS partitioning on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ieb4f115917722f39ca262c94ed1168d88e7b7a79
Closes-bug: #1261220

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-05 15:58:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/urls.py', 'openstack_auth/tests/settings.py', 'openstack_auth/views.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Support Django 1.4, 1.5 and 1.6

The default session serializer switched to JSONSerializer in Django-1.6.
Unfortunately, it can't serialize arbitrary objects (such as datetime
instances), there we have to stay with PickleSerializer (compare with
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/topics/http/sessions/#write-your-own-serializer).

Sets Django==1.4 for the py27dj14 tox testenv. Don't relax the version
requirements just yet.

Change-Id: Ifb5a68950fa6a4a652a0fb0cb81048d89763ec3f
"}]
commit_message:
Support Django 1.4, 1.5 and 1.6

The default session serializer switched to JSONSerializer in Django-1.6.
Unfortunately, it can't serialize arbitrary objects (such as datetime
instances), there we have to stay with PickleSerializer (compare with
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/topics/http/sessions/#write-your-own-serializer).

Sets Django==1.4 for the py27dj14 tox testenv. Don't relax the version
requirements just yet.

Change-Id: Ifb5a68950fa6a4a652a0fb0cb81048d89763ec3f

commit_message:
Add ability to get stdout/stderr to sshutils

Added new method `execute_generator` which yields stdout/stderr
data by chunks. Added new arguments `get_stdout` and `get_stderr`
to `execute` method. Now it returns tuple with stdout/stderr strings.

Change-Id: I4b6cf4764981c611679fb90505df8ec197224526

subject: Firstboot script modifications
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-17 11:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hadoop/post-install.d/firstboot', 'elements/hadoop/first-boot.d/99-setup', 'elements/hadoop/post-install.d/40-setup-hadoop'], 'message': "Firstboot script modifications

* Since first-boot.d is already deprecated in DIB proposed
  to remove of its usage from savanna-image-elements
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1212080
* Use rc.local directly instead of 'first-boot' scripts
* Added chown to ubuntu user for /etc/hadoop dir

NOTE: Such replacemnt is temporary and most likely we need to add os-refresh-config element from
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/tree/master/elements/os-refresh-config as a replacement of first-boot.d

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Berezovskiy <iberezovskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ic936be236a0604b1af72cb5553f435cb67f34ece
"}]
commit_message:
Firstboot script modifications

* Since first-boot.d is already deprecated in DIB proposed
  to remove of its usage from savanna-image-elements
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1212080
* Use rc.local directly instead of 'first-boot' scripts
* Added chown to ubuntu user for /etc/hadoop dir

NOTE: Such replacemnt is temporary and most likely we need to add os-refresh-config element from
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/tree/master/elements/os-refresh-config as a replacement of first-boot.d

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Berezovskiy <iberezovskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ic936be236a0604b1af72cb5553f435cb67f34ece

commit_message:
Fix double DELETE request for floating ips

There is douple delete request for floating ips
deletetion for the same floating ip.
So if ip delete in tests, we do not try to delete
it in TearDown any more

Closes-Bug: #1262795

trying to update them.

check that a detached FIP can be associated with a new VM and make sure
it is not associated with the old VM by assigning a different keypair to each

Change-Id: Ib535aa66638a3e7f2f1549b6e7a21a160377df6a

commit_message:
scenario/network_basic_ops: reassociate floating-ip

check that a detached FIP can be associated with a new VM and make sure
it is not associated with the old VM by assigning a different keypair to each
new VM so that ssh connection cannot be made without the right keypair

Change-Id: Ib535aa66638a3e7f2f1549b6e7a21a160377df6a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-09 22:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': "Convert lvm_mirrors to int

When the location_info is parsed and `lvm_mirrors` extracted, it is not
being converted to int. This causes some boolean checks to return True
even when there are not mirrors enabled because of the u'0'.

Closes-bug: #1258133
(cherry picked from commit 1dff30492f0ce1df3ef01ccc21353248a7207709)

Change-Id: I67c463d9f139fe326bbcab4d193c45459129b514
"}]
commit_message:
Convert lvm_mirrors to int

When the location_info is parsed and `lvm_mirrors` extracted, it is not
being converted to int. This causes some boolean checks to return True
even when there are not mirrors enabled because of the u'0'.

Closes-bug: #1258133
(cherry picked from commit 1dff30492f0ce1df3ef01ccc21353248a7207709)

Change-Id: I67c463d9f139fe326bbcab4d193c45459129b514

Change-Id: I3d63b0729c4ae9ec00ca97893c2ded65595235d1

commit_message:
Put _ ahead of unused variable subdirs

The variable is never used in loop, without `_' before the variable
name, pydev will mark a warning.

Change-Id: I3d63b0729c4ae9ec00ca97893c2ded65595235d1

Comment in "Attach Volumes to instances" ("Manage volumes" section), in

This limitation is related to hypervisor settings.
The documentation of this issue was recommended by John Griffith in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60257/

Related-Bug: #1217874

Change-Id: Ifa65ec6eecca23e85786b0fd79ae3b8ef8ebd537

'}]
commit_message:
Comment related to device name in attach volumes

Comment in "Attach Volumes to instances" ("Manage volumes" section), in
order to inform that device name may not match the one proposed by the user.
This limitation is related to hypervisor settings.
The documentation of this issue was recommended by John Griffith in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60257/

backport: havana
Related-Bug: #1217874

Change-Id: Ifa65ec6eecca23e85786b0fd79ae3b8ef8ebd537
(cherry picked from commit 76a040cb59a921142f2af30ef88ad1180fcaf2f8)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7135, 'name': 'Liang Chen', 'email': 'liangchen.linux@gmail.com', 'username': 'Liang'}, {'_account_id': 7253, 'name': 'Jason Dunsmore', 'email': 'jasondunsmore@gmail.com', 'username': 'jbd'}, {'_account_id': 9331, 'name': 'Pablo Andres Fuente', 'email': 'pablo.andres.fuente@gmail.com', 'username': 'pafuent'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-18 19:15:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_fault_middleware.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/common/wsgi.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py', 'heat/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'wsgi.Resource exception handling to not log errors

In order to not log some exceptions as errors, the
wsgi.Resource.__call__() was modified.
Instead of check if an exception is a HTTPBadRequest or a HTTPNotFound,
now all the exceptions that are not childs of HTTPError are raised
directly, without logging, translation or disguise.
If the exception is a child of HeatException, then the exception is
tranlated but not logged as an error. When this exception reaches the
Fault Wrapper Middleware it is logged as debug.
Some unused, or only use in test, exceptions were removed.

Change-Id: I105eeb74a55dcabc79cd3926dd88da0e19d1e1f1
Closes-Bug: #1231133
'}]
commit_message:
wsgi.Resource exception handling to not log errors

In order to not log some exceptions as errors, the
wsgi.Resource.__call__() was modified.
Instead of check if an exception is a HTTPBadRequest or a HTTPNotFound,
now all the exceptions that are not childs of HTTPError are raised
directly, without logging, translation or disguise.
If the exception is a child of HeatException, then the exception is
tranlated but not logged as an error. When this exception reaches the
Fault Wrapper Middleware it is logged as debug.
Some unused, or only use in test, exceptions were removed.

Change-Id: I105eeb74a55dcabc79cd3926dd88da0e19d1e1f1
Closes-Bug: #1231133

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-13 14:44:51.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'Add option for enabling debug logs only for nova

A new option --debug-nova-only was introduced to enable debug logs for
nova components, but not for external ones (e.g. ampq). The option has
no effect if --debug is on.

Change-Id: I56e6608b57841820e681155fc043fb36409c142c
Closes-Bug: #1207576

commit_message:
Add option for enabling debug logs only for nova

A new option --debug-nova-only was introduced to enable debug logs for
nova components, but not for external ones (e.g. ampq). The option has
no effect if --debug is on.

Change-Id: I56e6608b57841820e681155fc043fb36409c142c
Closes-Bug: #1207576

commit_message:
Added "novncproxy_base_url" directive to nova.conf

Added "novncproxy_base_url" directive to nova.conf for RHEL and SUSE.
Also unified formatting/phrasing around this directive and other
directives in this step for all distributions.  Without this
directive, URLs for remote console access to instances reference
localhost (127.0.0.1) rather than the controller node.

Change-Id: Id4e8c09c7bc81a2314bd9fea80e48349f19fb224
Closes-Bug: #1258287
(cherry picked from commit fcb8fec7ec8a5a2feef717c843f4f06491963636)

Added "novncproxy_base_url" directive to nova.conf for RHEL and SUSE.
Also unified formatting/phrasing around this directive and other
directives in this step for all distributions.  Without this
directive, URLs for remote console access to instances reference
localhost (127.0.0.1) rather than the controller node.

commit_message:
Cannot view detailed image with empty name.

After creating an image with empty name (only space characters in the name),
and attempting to view it, the view crashes.
Glance is not returning the name X-Meta-Header on the response if the
name is not set or empty.

Change-Id: I0c55e302d22552e932bdd32e10d00a103d252429
Closes-Bug: 1261367

commit_message:
Move mox into requirements.txt

mox is needed for the testr discovery machinery in order to get a list
tests. Without it testr fails while importing the unit tests (even if
they are not being run).

Closes-Bug: #1260094
Change-Id: I1572d08e9a0b9e79b5f55cd6b2b67904bccabcee

There is currently no way to change the http timeout for glance or

commit_message:
Add glance and cinder request timeout parameter

There is currently no way to change the http timeout for glance or
cinder requests. The default value may not be suitable for some cases so this
commits adds two new config options glance_url_timeout and cinder_url_timeout
that allow the user to manipulate these settings.

Fixes: bug #1207250
DocImpact

Co-authored-by: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I5239910a133cdacb90956688296d94eb5735b3e2

subject: Sends additional headers in API calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-10 14:19:53.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Sends additional headers in API calls

Enabled a feature to send additional headers on API calls.
Currently sending OS distribution in an X-Distribution header.
It relies on an [extra_headers] section in keystone.conf
All the existing headers there will be sent with the format
X-header_title. If some header needs to be ignored, None value
should be set on config file. Ex: Distribution=None

Change-Id: Ice32e78b4a54eb9ea9111c9c1c4763d900de763c
Closes-bug: 1259542
'}]
commit_message:
Sends additional headers in API calls

Enabled a feature to send additional headers on API calls.
Currently sending OS distribution in an X-Distribution header.
It relies on an [extra_headers] section in keystone.conf
All the existing headers there will be sent with the format
X-header_title. If some header needs to be ignored, None value
should be set on config file. Ex: Distribution=None

Change-Id: Ice32e78b4a54eb9ea9111c9c1c4763d900de763c
Closes-bug: 1259542

subject: Allow publish_errors to work with log notifier
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-02 18:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_notifier.py', 'openstack/common/log_handler.py', 'openstack/common/notifier/log_notifier.py', 'tests/unit/test_log.py'], 'message': 'Allow publish_errors to work with log notifier

Instead of checking whether the log_notifier is configured, move
a check into the log_notifier to see whether the message came from
the PublishError log handler.   This still protects against the
infinite loop, but now allows all of the other notifiers to work.

Removed previously overly conservative check added here,
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/4450/

Tests included to initiate from both log side and notifier side.

Closes-Bug: #1053422
Related-Bug: #883293

Change-Id: I793aa17215b747372f1bf8a6e236e55abd575008
'}]
commit_message:
Allow publish_errors to work with log notifier

Instead of checking whether the log_notifier is configured, move
a check into the log_notifier to see whether the message came from
the PublishError log handler.   This still protects against the
infinite loop, but now allows all of the other notifiers to work.

Removed previously overly conservative check added here,
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/4450/

Tests included to initiate from both log side and notifier side.

Closes-Bug: #1053422
Related-Bug: #883293

Change-Id: I793aa17215b747372f1bf8a6e236e55abd575008

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-19 02:20:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/forms.py'], 'message': 'Set "remove rule" field to be required in dialog

The dialog can be open from: the "Firewalls"->"Firewall Policies"

The "remove rule" field should be required, otherwise, user will
hit error when no rule is select. Removed "required=False",

Change-Id: Ifa21419bc93818335057bb16ed2683994c6efee7

commit_message:
Set "remove rule" field to be required in dialog

The dialog can be open from: the "Firewalls"->"Firewall Policies"
->"More" button of a policy->"Remove Rule"

The "remove rule" field should be required, otherwise, user will
hit error when no rule is select. Removed "required=False",
because it is default to True.

Added 'btn-danger' to the button style

Change-Id: Ifa21419bc93818335057bb16ed2683994c6efee7
Closes-Bug: #1252996

subject: Add debug log for checking used private_key
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-12-17 08:10:09.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_minimum_basic.py', 'tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Add debug log for checking used private_key

SSHException(Error reading SSH protocol banner) happens on bug1253896.
In most cases, this exception could happen if a private key (used for
ssh connecting) is different from a public key (stored into a server).
This patch adds debug log for showing the public key is set in a
server, both the private key and the public key of client side.

Change-Id: I4cc387ee2eba0365d05f1e3b20d5f656b53d5242
Related-Bug: #1253896
'}]
commit_message:
Add debug log for checking used private_key

SSHException(Error reading SSH protocol banner) happens on bug1253896.
In most cases, this exception could happen if a private key (used for
ssh connecting) is different from a public key (stored into a server).
This patch adds debug log for showing the public key is set in a
server, both the private key and the public key of client side.

Change-Id: I4cc387ee2eba0365d05f1e3b20d5f656b53d5242
Related-Bug: #1253896

commit_message:
Adds basic servers support for the Nova V3 API

Ports servers support from the v1_1 directory omitting functionality
which is no longer supported directly in the V3 API such as:

- floating ip
- add/remove/list of security groups
- disk config related functionality

Makes the appropriate modifications required for parameter name
changes between the V2 and V3 API

Booting an instance is not yet supported as this will require more
extensive changes as image listing services are no longer proxied
through the Nova V3 API

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: I1116e8d8ebc73176223f4135168cc4ab5d904356

commit_message:
Fix unable to add allow all IPv4/6 security group rule

Previously, if one tried to add a rule to allow all ingress ipv4 neutron
would respond that the rule was already part of the security group.
This happened as the filter for querying existing rules uses a wildcard for
remote_group_id thus returning a false match. This patch addresses
this issue.

Change-Id: I0320013a3869d25fb424995354721929465d2848
Closes-bug: #1252806
(cherry picked from commit 9335ffd7c3eaad0d66d7d19e7760ae12476a5ea2)

subject: Force catch_errors into pipeline
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-12-17 00:08:22.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/wsgi.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Force catch_errors into pipeline

This commit adds a hook for WSGI applications
(e.g. proxy.server.Application) to modify their WSGI pipelines. This
is currently used by the proxy server to ensure that catch_errors is
present; if it is missing, it is inserted as the first middleware in
the pipeline.

This lets us write new, mandatory middlewares for Swift without
breaking existing deployments on upgrade.

Change-Id: Ibed0f2edb6f80c25be182b3d4544e6a67c5050ad
'}]
commit_message:
Force catch_errors into pipeline

This commit adds a hook for WSGI applications
(e.g. proxy.server.Application) to modify their WSGI pipelines. This
is currently used by the proxy server to ensure that catch_errors is
present; if it is missing, it is inserted as the first middleware in
the pipeline.

This lets us write new, mandatory middlewares for Swift without
breaking existing deployments on upgrade.

Change-Id: Ibed0f2edb6f80c25be182b3d4544e6a67c5050ad

commit_message:
fix bug(1246551):del immediately after reboot vm
  If the instance was booted again before instance file
deleted, such as rebooted and destroyed at the same time,
if restart has been completed but destroy is still delete
instance file, this may be cause vm is still running but
instance file has been deleted.

Change-Id: I33bca5d32c68b563c58ca345c0860734b3003ba4
Closes-Bug: #1246551

commit_message:
Add policy check for server's start/stop in v3 api

This patch add policy check at api layer that follows bp v3-api-policy.
And use 'compute:v3:servers' as the policy scope for v3 servers core api.
Also provide default policy rule 'rule:admin_or_owner' for start/stop action.

Partial implements bp v3-api-core-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: If32a263dda81c30092e46fe1294e7e78ff68d4a5

commit_message:
Adding ability to relaunch jobs

Adding the ability to relaunch a job from a given job-execution (job configuration is preserved and editable).
There are options to either launch on an existing or a new cluster.

Implements: blueprint job-relaunch

commit_message:
Allow Falcon versions <0.2.0

Falcon 0.1.7 includes a bug fix wrt accept header parsing, that is needed
by Marconi.

I would like to allow future releases in the 0.1.x series in order to pick
up bug fixes like this without having to update global reqs each time.

Change-Id: I8352e406a1f7b28a53b3aef6c8b9b99f86120d55
Partial-Bug: #1261904

commit_message:
Add wait_for_any method to eventlet utils

This change introduces new utility funtion in eventlet utils, named
wait_for_any. It waits on one or more futures until at least some of
them completes. This is simplified version of concurrent.futures.wait
adapted to work with our green futures.

Change-Id: I2ab50c4e108ea1e9c81f618bd8fa8a8156bb695b

commit_message:
Introduce TaskExecutor

This change introduces new entity in the ActionEngine internals,
TaskExecutor. It's responsibilities are simple: take task and it's
arguments and execute it or revert it when engine says so.

Implements blueprint task-executor
Change-Id: I81c63bf4f43342a630f5aa9872fb14776e481176

subject: change the last-modified header value with valid one
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2013-12-19 09:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/functional/swift_test_client.py'], 'message': "change the last-modified header value with valid one

the Last-Modified header in Response didn't have a suitable
value - an integer part of object's timestamp.
This leads that the the if-[un]modified-since header with the
value from last-modified is always earlier than timestamp
and results the content is always newer than value of these
conditional headers.
Patched code returns math.ceil() of object's timestamp
in Last-Modified header so the later conditional header works
correctly

Closes-Bug: #1248818
Change-Id: I1ece7d008551bf989da74d23f0ed6307c45c5436
"}]
commit_message:
change the last-modified header value with valid one

the Last-Modified header in Response didn't have a suitable
value - an integer part of object's timestamp.
This leads that the the if-[un]modified-since header with the
value from last-modified is always earlier than timestamp
and results the content is always newer than value of these
conditional headers.
Patched code returns math.ceil() of object's timestamp
in Last-Modified header so the later conditional header works
correctly

Closes-Bug: #1248818
Change-Id: I1ece7d008551bf989da74d23f0ed6307c45c5436

subject: Remove duplicate debug option from keystone-all
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-13 20:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': "Remove duplicate debug option from keystone-all

The keystone server was started with the options like

 keystone-all ... -d --debug ...

The -d and --debug options are the same so one of them is
redundant.

This will make it less confusing if someone removes --debug and
thinks that debug is off, but debug is still on because they
didn't notice there was an extra -d.

Change-Id: I1ac977e6b12f1cc44f02b636c1bfb5c115b5b3e4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate debug option from keystone-all

The keystone server was started with the options like

 keystone-all ... -d --debug ...

The -d and --debug options are the same so one of them is
redundant.

This will make it less confusing if someone removes --debug and
thinks that debug is off, but debug is still on because they
didn't notice there was an extra -d.

Change-Id: I1ac977e6b12f1cc44f02b636c1bfb5c115b5b3e4

commit_message:
Shorten physical resource name to custom limit

The default limit for resources is 255, which is
determined by the column size of the name columns in
other openstack project databases.

The limit for nova servers is 53 characters due to typical default
linux HOST_NAME_MAX of 64, minus the '.novalocal' appended to the name.

The reduced name will consist of the following:
* the first 2 characters of the name
* a hyphen
* the end of the name, truncated on the left to bring
  the name length within the limit

The validation fix from bug: #1238272 has been removed.
Closes-Bug: #1250291

(cherry picked from commit 574f3ea54b1299f7f827bf0f6a88a83bccf9c3af)

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/server.py

Change-Id: Iccaf905b2e73433a671559c49223c2b635402853

Use CEILOMETER_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES as the environment
variable to include keystoneclient middleware's option in the config
generator's output.

Change-Id: Ibddeb587b22a0569dcb8db58d7cd8626b4482cb6
Closes-Bug: 1262331

Replace xrange in for loop with range

xrange is not supported in python 3, so replace it with six.moves.range

commit_message:
Do not trigger agent notification if bindings do not change

The method _process_port_bindings for the ml2 plugin should not
return True when the host binding does not change, otherwise an
unnecessary notification will be sent to the agent

Closes-Bug: #1255680
Related-Bug: #1253896
Partially Implements: neutron-tempest-parallel

Change-Id: I8a40090af347ca430ff6c8e2211fa34bb2bd0f8c

commit_message:
Change Oslo log imports to be consistent

In service.py, Oslo log was imported as "log" and in other Solum files Oslo
log is imported "as logging".  Changed service.py to be consistent with the
rest of the code for easier searching and code consistency.

Change-Id: I239248452466af6343a08d35f704b1925c090cd5

The value should not have .qcow2 appended to the end.

This prevents heat-slow tests from running in experimental.

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-12-17 16:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_rest_client.py', 'tempest/tests/fake_http.py', 'tempest/tests/fake_config.py'], 'message': 'Add unit tests for rest_client

commit_message:
Add unit tests for rest_client

This commit adds the first unit tests for the rest client. This is just
the first basic set of tests which were written to mostly verify some
common fake objects that will be useful moving forward. The intent is
for more advanced to be built off of this.

Partially implements bp unit-tests

Change-Id: I19173523ceec3c4fce62f9a3ab61cc9ee23c1801

commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Fixes bug #1259560

Change-Id: Id595630f97b21cc84aefc39b31e7f09f5fb8deb9

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary spaces from messages

If a timeout happens in _status_timeout(), exception message includes
many spaces like the following:

Timed out waiting for thing <<id>>                       to become ..

This patch removes them for log readability.

Change-Id: I5cfea5b447bcdd280b25878e95fa938229038d25

commit_message:
port instance_usage_audit tests into nova v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. This is being tried in order to make
reviewing of the porting easier as gerrit will display only what
is actually changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: I7d1e6437cca25ab7da4e1d74f617e51f17951ba6

commit_message:
WSDL patch script for vmware drivers

SOAP SUDS drivers may benefit from local storage and repair of WSDL files.
Support classes add hooks for WSDL "repair" actions.

This patch contains a simple script for the purpose of manually downloading
and patching WSDL files for use with SUDS.

Change-Id: Ib43901535041f32bfea01235be0ddbe52baca548
Blueprint: autowsdl-caching

subject: Implement account ACLs in tempauth, using the X-Account-Acl-* headers
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2013-12-11 00:17:18.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'test/unit/common/test_request_helpers.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py', 'test/functionalnosetests/test_account.py', 'test/functionalnosetests/swift_testing.py', 'doc/source/overview_auth.rst'], 'message': 'Implement account ACLs in tempauth, using the X-Account-Acl-* headers

Accounts now have three headers that represent ACLs, so that auth systems
can easily represent general account access (as opposed to container-level
access).  These headers are X-Account-Acl-Read-Only, X-Account-Acl-Read-Write,
and X-Account-Acl-Admin.

Swift requires swift_owner access to set or view those headers, but puts no
conditions or expectations on their content.  Auth systems (including
tempauth) are responsible for defining the content of those headers and
taking action based on them.

This patch defines the format of the headers (in the header_to_acl_list
method and its counterpart, acl_list_to_header), and teaches tempauth to
take action based on them.  Tempauth now sets swift_owner=True if the user
is on the Admin ACL, authorizes GET/HEAD/OPTIONS requests if the user is on
any ACL, authorizes PUT/POST/DELETE requests if the user is on the admin or
read-write ACL, etc.

Core Swift is responsible for stripping out the (privileged) ACL headers
from GET responses if the user is not a swift_owner.

DocImpact: Documentation for the new ACL usage and format appears in
summary form in doc/source/overview_auth.rst, and in more detail in
swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py in the TempAuth class docstring.
I leave it to the Swift doc team to determine whether more is needed.

Change-Id: I974865ce79327d6ae4a3955b125d603914a7b936
'}]
commit_message:
Implement account ACLs in tempauth, using the X-Account-Acl-* headers

Accounts now have three headers that represent ACLs, so that auth systems
can easily represent general account access (as opposed to container-level
access).  These headers are X-Account-Acl-Read-Only, X-Account-Acl-Read-Write,
and X-Account-Acl-Admin.

Swift requires swift_owner access to set or view those headers, but puts no
conditions or expectations on their content.  Auth systems (including
tempauth) are responsible for defining the content of those headers and
taking action based on them.

This patch defines the format of the headers (in the header_to_acl_list
method and its counterpart, acl_list_to_header), and teaches tempauth to
take action based on them.  Tempauth now sets swift_owner=True if the user
is on the Admin ACL, authorizes GET/HEAD/OPTIONS requests if the user is on
any ACL, authorizes PUT/POST/DELETE requests if the user is on the admin or
read-write ACL, etc.

Core Swift is responsible for stripping out the (privileged) ACL headers
from GET responses if the user is not a swift_owner.

DocImpact: Documentation for the new ACL usage and format appears in
summary form in doc/source/overview_auth.rst, and in more detail in
swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py in the TempAuth class docstring.
I leave it to the Swift doc team to determine whether more is needed.

Change-Id: I974865ce79327d6ae4a3955b125d603914a7b936
